																Fifa 23Nota: 1/10Voy a hacer una reseña tan realista como deberia ser el juego..Si, el sinulador de futbol mas conocido del mundo, el que desbanco a winning eleven o pro evolution no da mas de malo. Quizas una de las cosas que mas molestan es que el juego se venda al valor de un triple a, siendo realmente un DLC del fifa 2014(por nombrar uni viejo). Tampoco cuidan a los usuarios de pc, que en muchos casos para jugar este juego tienen que configurar el arranque seguro desde la bios.Al principio dije que iba a hacer una reseña realista, no como el hipermotion2 que promocionan como una “novedad”. El juego no cambio en lo mas minimo, la IA cuando quiere se pone modo inutil(tanto para vos como para el contrario) que ni un pase pueden dar. Tampoco hay partidos que terminen 1-0, 0-0, sino que el 95% de los partidos que vas a jugar van a salir con minimo de 8 goles. Y con esto me refiero a lo roto que esta el juego, que hay jugadores que con un poco de regate te pasan a todo el equipo, goles totalmente atajables, jugadores que le pegan desde japon y la meten y mas cosas.Otra cosa que nada que ver, pero para los que completan el 100% de los logros como yo, se tienen que fumar cosas como por ej: hay un logro que tener que llegar a hito 3 ( en el fifa anterior era hito 1 osea 20 partidos) que significa jugar 90 partidos en una temporada, o el subidon de precios en los atuendos del modo volta (piden 50 articulos), o ahora los momentos fut, que no sirven para absolutamente nada.CONCLUSION: no compren este juego sin estar en descuento. Cuando ven que no los compra nadie le meten 95% de descuento. Y aun asi no se si vale la pena.

																(UPDATED AS OF 1/1/23 AT BOTTOM)Game doesn't load. Running steam/EA (Origin)/Fifa23.exe as admins doesn't work. Reinstalling EA Anticheat doesn't work. Allowing everything thru firewall and antivirus (even turning them off) doesn't work. Changing bios to secure boot didn't work. Reinstalling game doesn't work. Any and all combinations of the above does not work.Requested refund from Steam. I have played maybe 4-6 hours right when it came out before the small update they pushed stopped it being able to load. I tried reverting to that initial version, doesn't work. But because Steam said I played more than 2 hours they won't refund it, even though it doesn't work. They told me to talk to EA. Requested refund from EA. They said to talk to Steam.Game won't work. EA wont fix it. They steal your money. Filing a report with the Better Business Bureau AND a deceptive practices report with the State's AG office, against BOTH Steam and EA. F them both, thieving C's.UPDATE:Filed a BBB report on EA. They said they cannot offer resolution such as a refund since I purchased through Steam. When I ask for a refund through Steam they state even though the game no longer works, its past their refund window and they cannot refund. So, filing a BBB report on Steam. If that fails to refund, then I am filing a Deceptive Practices report with my State's Attorney General's Office. I'll update further, potential class action lawsuit in the works.Also Steam has an F rating on the BBB - I wonder why??UPDATE 2 (1/1/2023);Finally got the game to play, here is how (worked for me - may not for others)-Uninstall Fifa 23-Uninstall EA App-Uninstall EA Anticheat in Programs Folder -Delete all EA Folders in Programs Folder-Close Steam, right click, Properties, Compatibility Tab, Run As Administrator.-Used CCleaner to delete all temporary files and clean registry errors-Settings, Gaming, Xbox Control Bar, Turn the Slider Off-Restart-Install Origin App, login, close, set to run as administrator-Reinstall Fifa 23 through Steam-Set Fifa 23 to run as administrator in the steamapps folder.-Set EA Anticheat to run as administrator in both locations: Programs Folder (under EA) AND Programs(x86) Folder under Steam-RestartOpen Steam, Open Origin, Run Fifa through Steam - WORKED FINALLYNOTE: I have been running in secure boot mode this whole time, so if you arent set to secure boot, you will also have to set that.I still dont recommend this game. It took me 4 months to figure out how to run this POS with zero help from EA and Steam. They also dropped the price of this sh!t game to like 25$ after I paid 85$ for early access and couldnt play it for 4 months. Think they'll refund that extra 60$? Fk no. So done with EA, never buying again.

Publicada el 30 de noviembre de 2022
 The biggest fall from grace I have ever seen  Technical Issues If you buy this game you might not be able to start it like the majority of people as you will see in other reviews. In order to start this game you will firstly need to enter your BIOS, on your high end PC, and change some settings, which if you don't know what you're doing can be extremely risky to the health of your PC. And from then on you will need to uninstall and re install EA's anti cheat on every start up of this game. Once in game you'll find that despite your ultra expensive custom high end PC, the menus are extremely laggy and unresponsive. If you want to tab out of this game, be sure that when you tab in, to move your mouse cursor to the very top right of your screen and out the way, because this game cannot disable the mouse while playing so if the mouse is hovering over a certain menu icon, and you try to navigate with your controller instead, the game will simply bug out. So just from a technical stand point this game is already atrocious. Gameplay Issues The game should be advertised as arcade, not the hyper realistic game it markets to be with all these new motion captures, ball physics etc that mislead. The gameplay is arcade, plain and simple. Remember FIFA matches being 5/6 mins a half,  by default.  Well this time the default is now 3 minutes a half, why? Because any longer, even on the highest difficulty, the score of the match will be 7-7 and you will be fighting against the game just to keep the score down to actually feel a sense of realism. Dribbling is so stupid I can't even put it into words, players are on ice here, no studs in the ground, every player has 1000 agility, because the way they chop and turn and dribble makes no sense, not even Messi can dribble like this in real life, and this is amplified against the AI on any high difficulty, you will not get the ball for at least 2.5 minutes of the 3 minute half because their dribbling is simply uncontrollable. Career Mode We all know career mode has been on the decline in forever, which every new feature either breaking the game or being pointless, the dynamic sim feature where you watch dots play like its FM needs so much work, its so bare bones and you will always need to jump in to save your side losing. The new highlight mode is complete garbage with only having a select few highlights, so once you've seen and played a few, you've played them all, and the scenarios get extremely repetitive because of this. Transfers get a transfer rating and whoever rating your business literally has 0 business sense, and you'll likely get sacked for making good business, not to mention you can't loan players out because every loan offer is a loan to buy with a stupid price that can't be negotiated without the deal falling through. All in all another stinker for career mode. Online I never got round to playing online as I spent all of my short time in this game troubleshooting and trying to fix the offline game play with various slider settings. But I can imagine the arcade feel of this game translates well to an online simplified experience where you do ridiculous skill moves and score plenty of goals. FUT mode is absolutely packed with features and I would recommend this mode if you have plenty of money you want to spend on getting the best players and items. Conclusion I have played FIFA all my life, since FIFA 2004, growing up with the game, buying it every year and without fail playing hundreds of hours. FIFA 17 onwards my hours declined as did the game, but it was still playable up until this release. I can't understand how this game was even able to release in the technical state its in and I genuinely can't believe the huge decline this franchise has gone on over the past half a decade. I'm extremely disappointed. But this game really shows EA for what they are, with extreme amounts of income, can't even spend on the resources to make this game actually playable, its a complete ripoff of all its fans and the kids that spend serious amounts of money on FUT every year, and everyone who has bought this game year in year out faithfully to play career mode.Utter disaster, don't purchase this game. 0/10

Publicada el 24 de noviembre de 2022
																I've bought every single FIFA since 2016 and this is by far the worst. The amount of problems it has on PC is insane. Here's a list of some I encountered:- Game doesn't start when I press play on Steam (I had to close Origin via Task Manager and try a few times)- Once that works, it says that anticheat is already installed and crashes the moment the game opens (fixed by manually uninstalling their anticheat and reinstalling it, but it doesn't always work)- Very high GPU usage and temperatures in the menus, much higher than when I'm actually in game. I have a good PC and no game has ever used this many resources. It runs at 144fps, but the temperatures and % usage is unacceptable.- Limiting the game to 60fps via the graphics menu does not work since it's a Vsync setting (full or half frames) based on your monitor refresh rate. This is something that hasn't been fixed for a few years now.Both this and gpu usage were fixed by changing graphics to low and limiting fps to 60 via Nvidia control panel.Keep in mind that even if you manage to make the game work, it's not guaranteed to keep working in the future. The gameplay is also a considerable downgrade from last year, but some people like it so I suppose that's subjective. Overall, it's clear that they don't care about PC. The price is the same as console version though, so I expect the same quality. I'll change my review if things improve, but that is very unlikely.EDIT: As of 8 December (and a game update later), I am still encountering the same issues. Do not buy it regardless of price.

Les paso el fix que me sirvió a mí y que no vi en ningún sitio online:- Poner en abrir como administrador a Steam, Origin y FIFA 23.- Ir a la carpeta FIFA 23 > _Installer > EAAntiCheat, abrir el programa, desinstalar el anticheat y reinstalarlo.- Verificar que tenga el arranque seguro activo en la PC (Información del sistema).- Hasta acá seguía con el error, pero lo que hice fue abrir la carpeta FIFA 23 y abrir el archivo "EAAntiCheat.GameServiceLauncher". Ahí, me tiró un mensaje "el juego ya está corriendo", abrió el juego pero quedó congelado en la pantalla de carga.- Cerré el juego, cerré la app de AntiCheat, cerré Origin y ejecuté el juego FIFA 23 desde el acceso directo y *bum*, abrió como si nada.Para cerrar, es una vergüenza que una empresa no resuelva estos problemas y tenga el usuario final que descifrar como hacerlo. Lo compré con 40% off pero en mi maravilloso país tengo que pagar el 95% de impuestos, así que a menos que esté en descuento, recomiendo que te compres otro juego.

He probado el modo carrera y trae dos o tres novedades pequeñas y tres o cuatro cinemáticas que se van repitiendo constantemente. ¿Está a la altura el juego? Pues como producto en conjunto por sus modos de juego, su marketing, sus licencias y parte de su gameplay es bueno. Pero no es un juego que consiga engancharme, no me dan ganas de jugar un partido tras otro. No hay cambios grandes con respecto a fifa 22 que justifiquen el alto precio del juego. Y sigue sin poder iniciarse desde Steam gracias a la genial idea del anticheat. El anticheat es un desastre, y lo es más para los jugadores off-line. El problema de esto es que los modders no saben si van a poder modificar aspectos del juego que no influyen de manera negativa en los jugadores de consola. El juego viene con muy pocas caras, creo que es el fifa con menos caras, faltan muchos jugadores a excepción de la liga inglesa que están casi todos. Si eso no puede modificarse, si no pueden añadirse nuevas botas, balones, guantes, tatuajes, logos de tv, cánticos, vallas publicitarias, y muchas caras que faltan sencillamente mucha gente no lo comprará incluyéndome a mi. Puedo entender el anticheat, aunque no lo comparto, en el online, pero no tiene ningún sentido en el offline. A los que jugamos modo carrera nos gusta tener el juego lo más real posible, así que mi reseña sigue siendo un NO rotundo al anticheat y un no recomendado al estado actual de este juego.Edit:Tras 15 horas de juego he de decir que ya no tengo el problema del anticheat, espero que el resto de usuarios tampoco lo tengan. El juego tiene detalles muy buenos, animaciones muy conseguidas pero hay muchas cosas por mejorar.  El caso es que pronto tocaran la jugabilidad y la harán más correcalles porque la gente se quejará de que es lento y bueno lo de todos los años. Haced un modo simulación y otro arcade y todos contentos. Poned más caras, faltan muchas y algunas importantes, y arreglad el patinaje de los jugadores. Cuando cambieis eso será un buen juego.

Publicada el 24 de diciembre de 2022
																For the love of God, don't buy this if you haven't already. I've sunk 100s of hours into every FIFA since 17, but this year's game is so bad I can't see myself getting much more, in fact I've outright deleted it off my pc. There's always something wrong or bad about a new FIFA game that comes out, but at some point you can get used to it and the game is still somewhat playable, not this time. 23 is just so outright horrid to play, game play is not consistent whatsoever and I can't remember having fun anywhere in the 36 hours I've played.Passing is one of the worst parts of this installment, half of passes that you would think are easily make-able are somehow intercepted and through balls are almost useless, as they'll never go where you aim them or the defender will gain a random boost of pace to somehow catch up to your quick winger/striker. Opposition goalkeepers will save almost anything, even to the point where it looks like they're disobeying the laws of physics (quite literally they'll levitate off the ground without making any jumping motion to reach your shot), all while your goalkeeper will dive the opposite direction of a shot or not fully extend his arms out to make an easy save.I could go on, and on, and on, and on, about how shameful this game is, it's easily the worst in the last 6 years, and that is saying something considering the quality of some of the past installments recently. It's just so bad, it should be considered a crime that I had to pay $76 including the tax, I should be able to sue for that. For the amount of money EA makes off the FIFA games, it's unacceptable they can put out garbage like this and slap a $70 price tag on it. Truth is no amount of money is worth this game, please do something else with that money, don't make my mistake where I wasn't even sure if I wanted it this year but caved in anyways. No chance I get a refund either since I've played over two hours, but this might be the worst money ever spent.I haven't even gone into the bugs and horrible launch of the game, I literally had to mess with settings of my computer's motherboard to even be able to launch the game, because apparently some setting in there was switched on that wouldn't allow the game to start, and those types of things are delicate stuff that can mess with your computer if you do something wrong. I also had to go into game files and add a code so the anti cheat wouldn't perform a first time setup every time I opened the game, as in the anti cheat would try to install itself every time I would try to play the game despite it already being downloaded.Also there is 100% scripting/momentum in FIFA, no matter what EA says. I actually believe it's the most blatant in this installment and a huge problem, besides the passing it's probably what frustrated me most, you can easily find proof of this on videos and online.This is literally a warning, do not buy this game, do not buy any of their games, please. They can't keep getting away with this type of stuff. I never write reviews for anything, but I had to this time.

Preferible pagar $1000 para que lo compruebes por vos mismo con las 10 horas de prueba que pagar $15000 y meterte el juego donde no da el sol. No tuve ningún inconveniente con el anti cheat ni problemas para abrirlo, pero por dios, se nota que está sin terminar. En primer lugar los menus, no tiene sentido que tengan tanto delay. Desde que realiza una acción pueden pasar 3 segundos hasta que lo ves reflejado en pantalla. Si querés hacerte un sbc anda pidiendote dos semanas de vacaciones en el laburo porque te va a tomar tu tiempo.El gameplay? Meh, me parece menos arcade que en fifas anteriores, si, pero ni por asomo es realista o divertido. Los jugadores son todos tosquisimos, da igual que estés con Mbappe, si el que tiene la pelota es Wanchope con 4 combos de libra encima, no lo vas a alcanzar ni en patineta. ¿Se te lesiona un jugador? Que no se te ocurra sacarlo, porque por alguna razón da igual que se le hayan roto los ligamentos, va a ir a todas las divididas con mas impetud que si estuviese al 100%. La defensa cambia totalmente, y para mal; en parte porque me cuesta un huevo usarla y en parte porque es una porquería. Es imposible mantener una marca con el L2, los centrales se van a ir a donde quieran o van a pegarle la patada más mala leche que vas a ver desde la de Krupoviesa al Rolfi Montenegro, que es lo unico bueno que le encontré de momento al juego, las patadas. De 10 partidos que jugué en Rivals, en al menos 7 se hicieron penales para ambos lados. Y mención especial a las cinematicas, que van a 3 fps. Hasta el juego mismo tiene bajones, está optimizado muy mal.No vale ni por asomo $15000 argentinos, y menos teniendo en cuenta que a dos meses del lanzamiento no han solucionado casi nada e incluso hay muchisimos jugadores que aún no pueden entrar al juego por conflictos con el anti cheat de EA

Publicada el 30 de septiembre de 2022
																STEAM DECK USERS can't play FIFA 23 on the deck because of the EA kernel-level anti-cheat software that detects Proton / SteamOS as "hacks", sort of. The only way to have it working is installing Windows 10 on the deck, which is bad news cause the overall performance gets worsened on the deck with Windows. And why does it even have a kernel-level anti-cheat, if the FUT transfer market isn't shared with us PC players? If you're on console, the market is shared between ALL the consoles: ps4, ps5, X1, XsX & XsS. But we PC players are excluded & can only trade between us. A kernel-level anti-cheat has way higher privileges then it should & having it installed is like having a hole in your PC's security that can be exploited by viruses. Now have in mind EA will be on charge... what could go wrong?  Here's a video explaining this & its consequences in depth.  Putting that aside: This game lays off a foundation on which they should build upon in the following game. It's a step in the right direction compared with the last title, since at least now we got Hypermotion2 & crossplat for the first time in PC, but sadly there are aspects to improve (+ tons of bugs). You can't play Volta online with your friends like you play online friendlies, leaving a massive mode (volta) to be played only against bots. Horrible decision. If you enable "listen to music while on gameplay" (which allows you to listen to FIFA songs INSTEAD of the commentators) you WON'T be able to skip songs while you're playing a match & you'll have to wait until the match is finished in order to skip the song. Also, no songs in online modes. For some reason is just plain silence for me.  EA has DISABLED "Remote Play Together", so you won't be able to invite your friends & play remotely, instead each one of you will have to pay $60. (Note that game publishers in Steam have the ability to enable or disable this).The mouse cursor hides itself at the center of the screen but in some instances it's still functional, meaning that if you're trying to select an option located on the edges, it won't let you & you'll think your controller is unresponsive, but is just the invisible mouse in the middle. So you'll have to move it away in order to be able to select the other options. You can reproduce this issue going into FUT > Moments. If you have 2 controllers & want to play split-screen, both players should use the same button layout. None of you can use different control settings because if one is different, it will overwrite the other player controller settings.  This happens to some users since FIFA 21 across all platforms, yet it has never been addressed by EA, which tells us they only care about FUT. After scoring a goal, the ball keeps rolling even if the player takes it with their hands as a celebration. The "classic" button scheme has been remapped, which doesn't affect me but I'm just mentioning it for those who care: LB+RB has been changed to "power shot". To execute a "Low Driven shot" you should gently press B and release it asap. LT+B does an outside foot shot if you're running. Sometimes your controller & camera settings won't get saved after closing & opening the game, it's a pain having to set it up every single times.Australia women's national team has been removed. There's a 10-hour trial of this new FIFA 23 on Xbox PC GamePass ($1 the 1st month)[www.xbox.com], & the whole game will be added to PC GamePass 7-9 months after its launch day (May-July 2023) like when they've added Fifa 22. So you should go try it. If 10hs aren't enough, you can buy EA Play Pro ($15 a month) & you'll get to play the whole game for 30 days, all the hours you want. Personally I would recommend waiting till the game hits $30, only then I'd buy it.

																Cómo hacer tortas fritas en 5 pasos.Ingredientes para hacer tortas fritas- ½ kilo de harina- 2 cucharaditas de sal- ½ taza de agua- 4 cucharadas de manteca o grasa vacuna- Aceite o grasa para freír- Azúcar a gustoPaso a paso cómo hacer tortas fritasColocar en un bol la harina tamizada y la grasa o manteca a temperatura ambiente.Agregar de a poco el agua y la sal e integrar los ingredientes.Amasar hasta que la preparación tenga ampollas en la superficie.Dejar reposar una hora. Luego, cortar bollitos, achatarlos con la palma de la mano o con un palo de amasar y pincharlos con un tenedor.Freírlas con aceite o grasa muy caliente y al retirar, dejar reposar sobre papel secante.Consejos para tener en cuenta a la hora de preparar tortas fritas.Hay algunos tips básicos que pueden ayudar a hacer las tortas fritas más deliciosas con un toque especial. En primer lugar, se recomienda usar harina leudante, para que la masa quede más esponjosa y aireada.En segundo lugar, a la hora de freír la masa es importante que no utilices aceite ya usado, asegurarte de que ya esté caliente cuando coloques los bollos en la sartén y que, una vez fritos, los coloques en papel absorbente. De esta manera, las tortas fritas van a quedar más livianas.Por último, espolvorear bien cada torta frita con azúcar va a darle el gusto tan característico a esta preparación. Si, en cambio, preferís un bocado salado, no ponerle azúcar y agregarle queso untable a la hora de comer también es una opción y queda riquísimo.

																Honestly... The franchise is getting tired... I love the FIFA franchise and own every single title since FIFA 94. The animations are good with the mo-cap, and the additional teams etc are nice. HOWEVER.Still can't play this game without having to perform programmer level shenanigans. EA-Anticheat is so broken, that even uninstalling it and reinstalling does nothing. You can't have any overlays on which sucks major donkey bolas for those of us that play and use discord, or even our cards overlay like Nvidia's. It's SUPER unoptimized. maximum and medium settings run the same for my rig which runs most modern AAA titles on ultra or very high. CGI cutscenes are choppy. gameplay is sometimes choppy depending on how it feels and it all adds up to an experience that would make you a pendehoe playing it in it's current state. I've tried getting a refund due to the dismal experience but they claim i can't because of the hours I have logged... Yes... Hours I have logged leaving the game open when I slept so I could still play without having to get a degree in computer engineering to get it to run.If this still hasn't dissuaded you from purchasing this game, then wait until the game launch bugs are fixed or you're going to uninstall it out of frustration like I have. Typing this as i get ready to try for the 13th time, to see if they've fixed anything.

Publicada el 4 febrero
																Está entretenido, pero si buscas un juego justo o libre de errores este no es tu juego.Desde un sistema que decide darte ventaja a ti o a tu rival en el partido para que pases de ganar 7-0 a perder 6-0 en el siguiente. Lo bueno es que cuando notes que tus jugadores no corren, se salen de su posición (como el portero cubriendo el primer palo y de repente echa a correr al punto de penalto o a la valla publicitaria y deja la portería sola o simplemente haace la estatua en los tiros que te hacen) o los rebotes van siempre a tus rivales o si le pasa esto a tu rival, sabrás como acabara el partido.Verás como un jugador con 60 de ritmo corre más que tu defensa de 90 y como con 54 de tiro marca obuses a la escuadra la única vez que llega mientras que tu Muller de 95 con media barra de potencia la saca del campo o se le va el control 6 metros en direccion al rival. Si tu rival es muy malo aun así puedes ganar pero corres el peligro de que el juego te eche o te quite el método de control sin dejarte manejar a ningún jugador y la única solución será cerrar el juego y abrirlo de nuevo.También podrás disfrutar de que cada vez que inicie el juego (si no crashea porque la nueva actualización lo dejó inservible temporalmente) te tratará como si fuera la primera vez, verás los tutoriales, el partido de demo, el trainer activado de nuevo, los entrenamientos o ajustes guardados se resetean, que no recuerde las carreras o torneos guardados hasta que empieces uno nuevo y recargue todos los anteriores... También puedes disfrutar de otra novedad, que cuando cambies entre los modos hay un 60% de probabilidades de que crashee, igual que te evita perder el tiempo al abrir los sobres en UT porque como tardes 2 segundos en saltar la animacion el juego crashea también.Pero no os preocupeis si al comprarlo algo de esto se arregló, porque a la siguiente actualización volverá otra vez y acompañado de nuevos errores.

Publicada el 6 de octubre de 2022
																I've always kinda defended FIFA. With the standard phrases like ''It's fun because it's a football game'', or ''You don't understand because you're not a football fan yourself''. But this is different. Way different.FIFA 23 doesn't even work... It's now a week after release and some folks still aren't able to even launch the game, I have to start Origin in Administrator Mode for it to work, but at least I can play. That being said, servers are trash. They always were, but it's even worse this time. Navigating through the menu's feels buggy and rough around the edges, the game is poorly optimized, and they even haven't fixed some issues that were in FIFA 22, which is astonishing to me.But now for the most important part, the gameplay. This is where FIFA 23 has it's occasional shine. PC-Players finally got Next-Gen after being completely ignored with FIFA 22 last year. While playing the game, you can feel the game isn't as arcade-like anymore. It's much more slow-paced, and you have to actually think about your next move or pass on the pitch. On the other hand, the AI is mind-blowingly dumb... Players are standing still when the ball rolls past them 15 centimetres away from their feet. Or suddenly your attacker cancels his run past the last defender, which is incredibly frustrating. And maybe the most ridiculous and game-breaking one, if you play against the AI, for example in Career Mode or Squad Battles, the opponent's goalkeeper can't even receive a pass... Like seriously, they are scoring own-goals like it's nothing.Some new features like the Power Shots are fun and make for some absolute bangers, but the game overall is underwhelming. This combined with the fact that some people that paid 70 or 80 bucks (!!!) can't even start up the game, gave me the feeling I should write a review for this 5/10 game. For now, stay far away from it.Congratulations EA, you've made the last FIFA, the worst FIFA.

Publicada el 22 de diciembre de 2022
																Ok, I'll start with saying I'm still currently playing this game, and for the most part am having fun. I'm not experiencing the issues Windows 11 users are, and the game starts up just fine for me. That being said, this game has serious issues that shouldn't be present in a game that has basically followed the same formula for the past decade. It should be getting easier to get this stuff right, not harder.1. On start up, I can't load my existing career save. The menu option just isn't there. To get around this I have to start a new career, and as soon as I'm able to, exit out. I'll then have the option to load my existing save. I have to do this everytime I load up the game.2. Not as serious, and probably for the best... I can't purchase FIFA points. I wanted to invest a small amount just to get started in FUT. Nope, constant error with the store. Just doesn't work, this is fine though, means EA don't get any more money from me, and I get to focus on career and other game modes.3. Menu and UI glitches. Trying to manage multiple transfer requests at once is buggy as hell. Can't move up and down the list half the time. This issue is not limited to this menu, however this is where it is most annoying, as I have to constantly leave and re-enter.Gameplay: It's fine, and the only thing about this game that seems to work as intended. It's a bit slower, but FIFA over the years changes it's focus from time to time when it comes to gameplay and the rest of us just have to adjust.It's abundantly clear that EA don't give a **** about this game on PC.

Publicada el 6 de octubre de 2022
																Es el segundo FIFA que juego. El anterior fue el 2022.Los cambios del 22 al 23 son notables, hay un motor gráfico nuevo (Hypermotion 2) que hace convierte el juego mas en un simulador de fútbol que algo mas arcade como creo me acostumbró el 22.El modo que más juego es el Ultimate Team y la verdad es que, por lo que comentaba antes, el juego me resultó mas difícil, sin embargo es un desafío que me resulta interesante.Lo malo, está muy mal optimizado. Entiendo lo de la incorporación de un nuevo motor gráfico, un anticheat, etc. Pero desde la salida anticipada (27 de Sept) salió con varios problemas de optimización. Tengo una pc de gama alta y el juego no me supera los 120fps en todo Ultra y al momento de las cinematicas de los corner, saques de arco, etc, dropea a 30 y se hace molesto ese "desync" que hay de frames.Por lo demás, está interesante, es un juego competitivo de fútbol. Por obvias razones el juego es "similar" al anterior, no esperen que los jugadores tiren rayos láser por los ojos.Es costoso, al mejor estilo EA, pero para las horas de diversión que me otorga y el modo competitivo online, es por eso que lo recomiendo.

Tema velocidad tambien esta ajustado, los juegadores "Lentos" mas o menos con 60-70 de ritmo son utilizables. Publicada el 15 abril
																This game is the absolute worst videogame in the universe. I only play this toxic game because PES messed up and there's no better alternative. My best advice is to stay well clear of this game until another football videogame comes out like UFL or GOAL. I am looking forward to these two  games coming out which will hopefully up the competition for FIFA and I sincerely hope that this game crashes and burns and is long forgotten. To the developers of FIFA, I truly hope you find another job and stop making shi**y football games, you guys should develop Microsoft XP games instead in my opinion. To the people in marketing or whatever in FIFA, their cash grabbing culture is disgusting and they prey on people's credit cards to keep spending their hardly earned dollars or mother's credit card money, I hate myself for being such a big fan of football that I must play a football game even though it's a steaming pile of garbage. The promotions they keep pushing in ultimate team are ridiculous and the power curve has gone to sh*t. The game does not even make any sense anymore and it's so ridiculously buggy that sometimes you're not even able to play the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game. The servers in this game are also trash, where on a good day you can actually play football. But that 'good day' happnes 1 out of 10 times you play FIFA. Don't even get me started on the number of cheaters on PC which again, makes the game even harder to play and enjoy. Also, bottom line, the quality of football in FIFA is unrealistic and they develop the game in such a way so even a casual player who knows f**k all about football can beat you with the right players and with 50-50 duels and bounce backs going their way. Then we have the inside cut where sweaty children dribble the ball around the corner flag then cut inside to the penalty area pass the ball into a player who just passes it into a goal. I truly truly hope that EA dissolves as a company and all people working for it work on other games, and I hope that they work on games that I wouldn't touch in my wildest dreams. The way the style their objectives and promos and their swaps is tailored in such a way that they just want to keep you playing day in day out for sweet new packs, players which is least to say exhausting. I do not have the time for all of this and I only play for the weekend league which has also turned into a sweat fest with tryhards who exploit the game in such ways that you cannot win. Also, the only way to have a lot of coins in FIFA is to buy coins and/or FIFA points and also to trade your way. 90% of people (when I say people I mean people who actually work and don't spend 24-7 on this idiotic game) don't have time to trade players or to grind objectives. Pro clubs is actually sometimes fun and it has so much potential to be even better than FUT but they haven't paid any attention to this game mode so much so that it's not even a viable option. Then we have the career mode which was fun 10 years ago when FUT didn't exist or was a new thing. I would find myself playing for days as a manager or even a player but now of course since it's EA they haven't paid any attention to career mode and it's so poorly done and full of bugs that you're wasting time just trying to do something and build a team. For all the people who love football, I recommend everyone to play the Football Manager series as it's honestly the best videogame regarding football. You do not get to play like in FIFA but you get to manage a team and so many other things. Once again, I really really hope that EA and FIFA (EA SPORTS FC) are no more and for people to stop funding this stupid game. Stay well clear of this game, 1/10. The 1 point I gave is for it being a football game. F*** EA and F*** FIFA.

Publicada el 6 febrero
																FIFA 23 is the most famous football and sports video game out there. It is very sad that football video games are monopolized by EA Sports, which make them do whatever they want, without much consequences. I have been playing football video games since I was a kid (Winning Eleven, Pro Evolution Soccer, and FIFA), and I found them very enjoyable. It really sucks to see how much the quality went down compared to old days. Anyway, there are multiple reasons that push me to not recommend this game, but the main one, is the lack of online 2v2 party game, which has been missing for years now. I am not fan of career mode, I am not fan of FUT, I am not fan of any special mode. I want to play a football video game with real clubs with my friends online in 2v2 parties. I will keep on disliking on FIFA as long as 2v2 lobbies with friends are unavailable. 6/10 overall for the game.

Publicada el 28 mayo
																Soy un padre de 50 años, probablemente una de las personas más viejas que juegan este juego. Soy padre soltero de mi hijo, que ahora tiene 14 años. Mi hijo recientemente descargó este juego Fifa y en menos de una semana, ya había jugado durante más de 20 horas. Esto fue terrible para mí, ya que ya era bastante difícil para mí pasar tiempo con mi hijo, ya que él siempre sale con sus amigos o simplemente mira videos en Tiktok. Así que decidí crear una cuenta de Steam y comprar este juego para ver si podía jugar junto a él. Cargué el juego, hice el tutorial pero estaba atascado en lo que se suponía que debías hacer. Le pedí ayuda a mi hijo y organizó un juego para que yo me uniera. Me encantó porque era el mejor momento que había pasado con mi hijo desde que mi esposa había muerto. Desde entonces, este juego ha acercado a mi hijo y a mí nuevamente y ahora también pasamos tiempo juntos fuera de la casa. Este juego me recordó que hay diversión en todo, y nos ha traído tanto a mí como a mi hijo muchos recuerdos felices.

Publicada el 17 de diciembre de 2022
																Cada FIFA que sale es peor que el anterior, esa es la constante. El año pasado compré el FIFA 22 (ante la decadencia del eFootball que pasó a mejor vida) y terminé pidiendo reembolso. No puedo opinar demasiado del juego porque apenas he podido hacerlo andar. Solo voy a decir que estuve un buen rato hasta que pude ejecutarlo (problemas con Origins y el Anticheat de EA). Una vez que inició, mil problemas de menú lagueado con respuesta tardía a los controles, no reconocimiento de joystick, configuración con el teclado que luego no me reconoció en el partido, jugadores que se veian sin color ni textura (completamente grises) en la elección de las camisetas. Partido totalmente lento y a bajos FPS con una buena computadora en la que corro por decir algo el Red Read Redemption 2 en 1080p en gráficos ultras, con todo al máximo y a casi 90FPS. Imposible creer que este juego pida más PC que el RDR2, pero parecería ser el caso, dada su tan mala optimización. Y por si faltaba algo, los mismos comentarios horribles de siempre, ya sea en español mexicano (argentino) de Fernando Palomo y Mario Kempes o de España, con Manolo Lama y Paco Gonzalez. No sólo la forma en que hablan es horrible, sino que el guión, las cosas que dicen, son cosas absolutamente ridículas que no se escuchan jamás en un partido de fútbol de la vida real. Otro año más, toca seguir jugando al PES 2021 con parches.

Publicada el 22 abril
																Soy un padre de 50 años, probablemente una de las personas más viejas que juegan este juego. Soy padre soltero de mi hijo, que ahora tiene 14 años. Mi hijo recientemente descargó "fifa" y en menos de una semana, ya había jugado durante más de 20 horas. Esto fue terrible para mí, ya que ya era bastante difícil para mí pasar tiempo con mi hijo, ya que él siempre sale con sus amigos o simplemente mira videos en Tiktok. Así que decidí crear una cuenta de Steam y comprar este juego para ver si podía jugar junto a él. Cargué el juego, hice el tutorial pero estaba atascado en lo que se suponía que debías hacer. Le pedí ayuda a mi hijo y organizó un juego para que yo me uniera. Me encantó porque era el mejor momento que había pasado con mi hijo desde que mi esposa había muerto. Desde entonces, este juego ha acercado a mi hijo y a mí nuevamente y ahora también pasamos tiempo juntos fuera de la casa. Este juego me recordó que hay diversión en todo, y nos ha traído tanto a mí como a mi hijo muchos recuerdos felices.

																Por fin la versión de PC se une a la de PS5 y XBSX, y encima con cross-play, lo que es una gran noticia. - Ritmo: Este es un juego mucho más pausado que el anterior, al menos hasta que lleguen las actualizaciones.- Animaciones: El gran salto respecto al año pasado. El nuevo sistema Hypermotion 2 se nota una barbaridad, ofreciendo unas animaciones mucho más realistas que en ediciones anteriores, sobre todo de los porteros.- Gráficos: Muy continuista, poca novedad respecto al anterior.- IA: Se nota más sencilla en Clase Mundial y Leyenda, aunque más realista, ya que solo los mejores equipos consiguen aguantar la posesión indefinidamente. Necesitaré más tiempo para explorar esto a fondo.- Ultimate Team: Cada vez dan más opciones al jugador para conseguir un equipo decente sin gastarse dinero, por medio de objetivos, con los que se consiguen sobres y cartas, lo cual se agradece mucho.

Ok then, - after some googleing I came accross some solutions that mentioned issues with the anti-cheat, so followed all those, but none worked. Ok sure, I'll turn on Secure boot then purely for Fifa as I generally think the games are worth it. After that the game finally "started" but got stuck on the startup screen with 3000fps and my GPU going haywire.. tried a couple times and gave up as I didn't feel like troubleshooting even more then I already spent JUST TO GET THE GAME STARTED. Refunded, what a buggy mess, even before getting in-game. Do not buy on PC, unless they get rid of the ridiculous anti-cheat that causes most of these issues. Maybe some day they will fix it, but for now still really NOT recommended!

Postre muy fácil de prepararIngredientesPara la masa de los panqueques: 250 ml de leche entera135 g de harina de trigo o harina 0000, harina floja de repostería2 huevos MPara hacer en la sartén: Manteca (mantequilla) o 50 ml de aceite de oliva virgen extraMiel o dulce de leche para acompañarLos panqueques son una de esas recetas perfectas para principiantes. No tienen ningún tipo de dificultad y están deliciosos, siendo perfectos para el desayuno o la merienda.Los panqueques, son una especie de crêpe, que se elabora calentando porciones de la pasta de sus ingredientes en una sartén. Se suele preparar en toda Latinoamérica, pero es más común encontrarlos en las cocinas argentina, chilena, uruguaya y paraguaya para comerlos como postre, pero también en formato salado.No os vamos a ♥♥♥♥♥ que en casa hemos hecho estos panqueques o tortitas americanas en más de una ocasión, pero ya sabéis, nos pierde el dulce. Esta receta la llevamos utilizando bastante tiempo y la verdad que no tiene ningún misterio, pero lo mejor es que la puedes mezclar con casi cualquier cosa: dulce, salado… Da igual, lo que le eches a un panqueque estará de rechupete.Cómo hacer panquequesColocamos en un bol o recipiente la harina y añade el huevo y la leche. Asegúrate de mezclar bien los ingredientes hasta que no queden casi grumos. Una vez tengas la masa lista, dejamos reposar la mezcla en la nevera o heladera por unos 5 minutos para que la harina se hidrate.Aunque este paso del reposo es opcional, se podrían hacer también directamente.Calentamos una sartén antiadherente en el fuego a potencia media baja con un poco de aceite o manteca (mantequilla). Cuando esté caliente, echa una cucharada de la mezcla y espera a que se cuaje bien la masa.Cuando la superficie de los panqueques comience a verse ligeramente cuajada, volteamos con ayuda de una lengua de silicona o una espátula.Vamos poco a poco haciendo panqueque por panqueque con paciencia, enmantecando cada tanto el fondo de la sartén para dar sabor y evitar que se peguen a la superficie. Hay que tener cuidado de que no se caliente demasiado la sartén o panquequera y no hay que intentar despegarlos pues se van a despegar ellos solos.Cocemos por el otro lado durante un minuto (no más) antes de retirar a un plato. Listos para comer.

																This game should be the final nail in the coffin for EA and Football games. We all know the next game won't be FIFA, and we've also all known for a long time now that EA simply think very little of their player base, but we're also at fault. We buy the game year-in year-out because we love football and want to play football, but the problems with this game series isn't necessarily with the gameplay itself, otherwise we wouldn't play it. Our biggest issue is how EA treat us and how we let them get away with it every year.With FIFA 23, I haven't had any issues while playing the game, but as all of us know, this game has problems opening, a lot, and it's down the anti-cheat that EA has implemented with this game. The anti-cheat has ruined this game for almost everyone. Everytime there's an update there's a new issue, a temporary fix, and the cycle repeats. Lately, I haven't been able to play the game for the longest period since I got it, but the consistent issues have pushed me beyond frustration. I have played every entry in this series since FIFA 07, but I have never been this insulted by EA. I hope this game is the one that shows all of us players that they really, truly do not care. And if they want to prove me wrong, put out a statement, address the fans, tell us what you're doing to fix this stuff.

Publicada el 29 de septiembre de 2022
																EA, you did it again. You messed up the launch, again. Like you do every year. It is totally unacceptable that you charge almost 100 bucks for the Ultimate Edition that grants you 3 days early access - let us be real, that is why most of us buy Ultimate Edition - but launching the game 3 days early is basically a game of Russian roulette - either you are lucky as hell and the game launches and plays, or you are unlucky like thousands of consumers and get error messages, failing anti-cheat and whatever else there is preventing people from getting what they paid for. This is a complete slap in the face to your customers and something you should address immediately. The anti-cheat is a good idea and I am glad it is coming to PC, as the previous iterations of FIFA on PC were clearly plagued by hackers - so this is a welcomed addition, but the execution of the anti-cheat is horrendous. I know people that bought the Ultimate Edition that should have been able to play the game 2 days ago that still can not launch the game due to the anti-cheat being absolutely garbage. Fix this. Bugs, where do I begin? There are a plethora of bugs in the game, from missing sponsors on a dozen of kits, visual bugs like the ball becoming super blurry and the performance of the actual game itself completely tanking. I am on a 3060 and an i5-11400CPU and there is no chance in hell my FIFA should be full of stutters and lags. The lag in the menu is atrocious, set-pieces and cinematics (I love the addition of cinematics) is PLAGUED by frame-drops which makes them horrible and painful to look at. Given how much of a copy-paste game FIFA is every year, these bugs are inexcusable. Usually, every year, we are used to getting the new stadiums of the teams that are promoted to say the Premier League. Where is Nottingham Forest' stadium? Last year you had to give us Leeds' stadium through an update later and you were excused due to COVID, but what is the excuse now? This is just laziness - you mean to tell me a billion dollar company like EA with well over a year of development can not make the stadium ready for release? Call this nitpicking, but for me it is the small things that matter.As far as actual gameplay goes, I do enjoy the feeling of the players and the ball. It feels like the players and the ball have actual weight to it now and it feels much less arcade-like to me. I thoroughly enjoy the slower pace feel, although it could do with some fine tuning. The new engine makes a massive difference (thank God you brought it to PC this year) and it is noticeable, so in that regard I am hopeful for a good year of FIFA. With all of these things addressed, I would like to say this year sees the end of an era. I started playing FIFA in 2003 on my brother's original Xbox and I have played pretty much every iteration since. I grew up with the game and I have so many good memories like coming home from school and inviting friends over to play some FIFA. That is what the beautiful game is all about - the game that has seen us cry, laugh, angry and every other conceivable emotion possible. The game we know as "FIFA" will be no more, but that does not mean the end of football games - I am hopeful for the future and I HOPE that EA will start caring more and focus on improving their games and game-modes that have been heavily neglected (I am looking at you, Career Mode and Pro Clubs). Arrivederci, FIFA, it has been an honour.

Producto recibido de forma gratuita
																As you see, EA blessed ya boy with a review key when I asked. Did my stupendous writing woo them? The big follower count of my curator? 1018 hours in FIFA 22? Perhaps my moustache? Yeah, it was probably the stache. It is pretty magnificent.Before we start, the game finally comes equipped with an anti-cheat. But it's also a kernel-level anti-cheat. I'm aware of the debate surrounding this type of software, but I have no issue with it. I'm happy to share my homework folder with anyone, hacker or not.But besides needing to install the anti-cheat software manually, I can't say I had any bugs or bees. Same for optimization. Running on a Ryzen 7 5800X paired with an RTX 3070 and 32GB of ram, all nicely displayed on my glorious ultrawide 1080p monitor with everything maxed out — it was all peachy.The last danceFirst, let's talk gameplay. The meta shifts from short, fast, agile and lean players to just lengthy. But what does lengthy mean? Well, it's a new style of sprinting, which determines what kind of running animations a player has. There is also explosive and controlled. But nobody cares about them — we all want to be lengthy. No use in lying. Yet only a select few meet the requirements - high strength and low agility. Finally, players such as Lewandowski, van Dijk, Kane, Fabinho, Casemiro, etc., are usable. Seems EA liked the joke "He runs like he has a third leg" so much they decided to make it a gameplay feature. And, oh boy! These lengthy men do be fast. They do need a couple of seconds to gain momentum tho and are still pretty poor in tight spaces. So, not stupidly overpowered like the previous meta. Ying-Yang boys, ying-yang. And I like how it has made "slower" defenders, below 85 pace, usable against pacey attackers, 90+ pace. This was something the ratty pace merchants would try and abuse, time and time again. How the turntables...We also get a new type of shot — the power shot. Finally, we can smash the ball as hard as possible. It does require manual aiming, so it's not as easy as the regular shot. But, please, EA, I'm begging you — do not make aiming semi-assisted in the future. Leave the risk-reward intact.Another area that received some love is the set piece taking, giving us more control over how and where we hit the ball. Previously, only those using a keyboard could aim without the reticle spazzing like crazy. But now, you have a simple line showing where the ball will go and an indicator of the type of shot you'll take. It feels almost PES-like. However, I'm not a fan of not being able to zoom out during corners and free kicks like in previous entries. It makes set pieces in local co-op way harder to execute. I hope they bring the option back.https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2869657264And that's about it for the new stuff. Besides the abundance of new animations, courtesy of HyperMotion 2, and the continued refinement of player movement and physics, there is very little left to say. Perhaps nerfing the outside-the-foot shot? I've played games against people who do nothing but spam this shot type. It's just that overpowered.But what about the modes the game offers?Look, I'm gonna make this as quick and painless for you non-Ultimate Team players out there — yet again, almost nothing changed. Pro Clubs is still the same 11v11 PvP it was all this time. Volta again feels like a cheap Fifa Street populated only by selfish players. As for Seasons, it's just PvP with real-life clubs/nations. Can't really do much to improve that. But Career mode did receive some new "stuff" — using real-life managers and a more interactive player career. The latter was fun, with your actions on and off the pitch pushing you towards one of the three personalities, each giving you different attribute boosts. Call your manager's mother a hamster, or buy a high-end mattress - the choice is yours!With that out of the way, it's time to see what we, the gambling simulator addicts, get in this year's FIFA Ultimate Team, or FUT for short.And what better way to start this segment than with a controversial take. So, lord, forgive me for the words I'm about to say — FUT is live service done right.https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2884903427Alas, no, I'm not joking. To me, FUT is a perfect example of this model done right. It receives a healthy stream of content throughout the year; Special cards, daily SBCs, weekly objectives, multiple seasons with season passes to grind, player card objectives, and so on. I'm always incentivized to come back. And unlike the heavy Pay2Win pre-FIFA 17 era, being a non-paying customer and having a good team is completely viable now, with the game rewarding you for simply playing it.And this year, we see tectonic changes to the chemistry system. And boy, does me likey. Loyalty, the iconic green/yellow/red strings and penalties for low chemistry, like a fart in the wind, it's all gone. Instead, we have three squares to fill, with player stats not getting crucified due to low team or player chemistry. How is that possible? Magic probably. Best not to dwell on it. Instead, focus on how to fill them squares. Like before, players gain chemistry from nationality, league, and club links. But, now you need only worry about slotting the player in his god-given position so that he can give and receive chemistry.https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2869576815And I'm already in love with this change. The chemistry system of old felt restrictive, punishing me for trying to be creative if I didn't reach a certain chemistry threshold. Thankfully, now that is no longer the case, and EA won't spank me for trying to use a unique team. Another new addition is secondary positions for each player, which you can assign to them by using position modifiers on said player.We also get more stuff to do with FUT Moments. But I won't lie — it's pretty dull. Thrust into specific match scenarios, you're tasked with completing objectives - pass the ball 3 times, score a goal, don't concede, etc., all needing to be accomplished within a given timeframe. Not very creative, nor that interesting to do. But then again, you can only ask so much of players to do while playing a football match. And completing these objectives nets you stars, the mode's currency, which can be spent in its shop on some packs.But for me, Squad Building Challenges, where you build squads and submit them to earn packs and players, are still the best part of FUT. They are like puzzles with unique requirements (only 5 players from one nation, no more than 3 leagues, squad rating 80, etc.) you must solve.The rest...Well, Division Rivals and FUT Champs, the two main PvP modes,  see you duke it out with other players to see who is more sweaty and immature. As for Squad Battles...I would literally give EA money to remove it. The rewards are not that great for what is asked of you — play 40 games in a week and earn at least 1,5k points per match (World Class or higher difficulty) to reach Elite 1 (40-50k usually). Cut that number down to 20, and we can talk. The Draft is ok and has a PvP and offline version. But I think it's time for a change when you have an entry fee and crappy rewards. So, EA, just make it free. Allow people to enjoy one of the best aspects of FUT — making fun squads and using unique players.So yeah, that's pretty much it, innit?And with EA closing the book on its FIFA franchise by parting ways with FIFA (the international governing body of football), it's truly the end of an era.FIFA is dead, long live EA Sports FC!If you enjoy this review, come and read more wisdom from the Gospel of Sv. Prolivije

																FIFA 23: The Worst Game in the History of GamingWarning: Proceed at your own peril. FIFA 23 is a disgrace to the gaming community and a tragic waste of your time, money, and sanity.As a long-time fan of football and video games, I never thought I'd see the day when I would be forced to write such a scathing review. But here we are, with FIFA 23, a game that has not only failed to live up to its predecessors, but has also managed to become an unmitigated disaster in every sense of the word.I cannot emphasize enough how bad FIFA 23 is. Imagine a steaming pile of garbage on your doorstep, and you're getting close. This game is so deplorable, it's almost an insult to refer to it as a "game." It's more like a cruel prank, a travesty that shakes the very foundations of the gaming world.Sickening GameplayIf you thought the gameplay in previous FIFA titles was smooth and enjoyable, prepare to be bitterly disappointed. FIFA 23 has taken all the elements that made its predecessors great and thrown them out the window. The controls are clunky, unresponsive, and frustrating. It's as if the developers coded the game with their eyes closed and their hands tied behind their backs.Disgraceful GraphicsDespite having access to next-gen technology, FIFA 23 looks like it was made in the late '90s. The graphics are so abysmal that it's difficult to tell which pixelated blob is supposed to represent your favorite footballer. The stadiums, the crowd, and even the grass on the pitch – everything is an eyesore.Unforgivable In-Game PurchasesFIFA 23 has taken microtransactions to an entirely new level of greed. It's as if EA Sports wants to suck every last cent out of your pocket. The game is so heavily designed around in-game purchases that it's virtually impossible to progress or enjoy the experience without shelling out an exorbitant amount of money.A Laughable Career ModeThe career mode in FIFA 23 is an absolute joke. It's as if the developers put no thought or effort into creating a compelling and immersive experience. Instead, they've given us a shallow, uninteresting, and downright boring mode that will make you question why you even bothered to turn on your console.To Sum It UpFIFA 23 is, without a doubt, the worst game ever created. It's an affront to the gaming community and a disgrace to the FIFA franchise. If you value your time, money, and sanity, stay far away from this abomination.Do yourself a favor and avoid FIFA 23 at all costs. This is not a game. It's a nightmare.

Publicada el 7 de diciembre de 2022
																EA manages to make FIFA worse every year. I'm a huge fan of Pro Clubs and I thought FIFA 22 Pro clubs was unplayable at the time. FIFA 23 Pro Clubs makes FIFA 22 Pro Clubs look incredible. Over the top balls are now non-existent, pace is non-existent (a 50 pace CB outruns my 92 pace ST), all my passes and shots feel weak, RB passes are so inaccurate I can't even use them, the shooting is horribly under powered (all shots feel slow motion except those one-off shots that come off of a foot like a rocket), the free-kick and penalty mechanics are terrible (why does EA need to over complicate what used to be simple aim and shoot mechanics), the AI in Pro Clubs are brainless (constantly making decisions that lead to goals for the other team, they love setting up counterattacks for the other team), defending feels worse than ever (slow and clunky, ball often bounces around and the opponent winds up with the ball even after a good clean tackle), the GKs love to punch the ball right in front of opposing players (and also into their own nets), One-time shots are busted because my players always settle and take an extra touch before shooting (which eliminates the opportunity). In FIFA 21 and 22 Pro Clubs I played over 500 games in both games. In FIFA 21 I averaged close to 3 goals a match with an avg rating of close to 10. In FIFA 22 I averaged 2 goals for every match played with an avg rating of 8.9, in FIFA 23 so far I have played 19 games with 7 goals and a 6.1 avg. It is way too difficult to create chances anymore. The fluidity has been taken out of the game. EA forces you to pass to death to score, the issue with that is the AI complete their passes maybe 50% of the time. Try to string together more than 10 passes using your AI, bet its quite the task. I've never been much of a FUT guy, because I know how scripted the online matches are. I have now resorted to playing online friendlies with my brother instead. Yes we play each other over and over and over again, but its 1000% more enjoyable than enduring a Pro Clubs match. When will EA or any other football dev create an online career mode? I have been waiting for a game mode like such. That is what I would like to see in the next game. I will purchase the next game solely for that game mode. If FIFA 24, or whatever the franchise is going to be called next year, does not include this game mode, I am done purchasing these games. Fare thee well.

																Finally the damn thing ran, I did this:1. Enable secure boot in bios (game will say secure boot is not enabled until you do it)2. Run both EA and steam as admin, make sure both are updated, and restart them3. Make sure graphics driver is updated4. Install game from steam5. Verify game cache (steam, fifa 23, properties, local files, verify)6. in the game install folder, I went to the anticheat folder and ran the anti cheat installer as administrator, I did uninstall all, then selected fifa, then installed again7. In the game folder, I set the game exe and the launch anti cheat exe to compatibility mode all users, run as administrator8. In the game install folder, I reinstalled digital certificate (both local user, and machine) for both the launch anticheat dll and exe (until you do it, game will just show up as running on steam, but anticheat won't show up at all and game won't actually start)9. Disabled advanced threat detection in bit defender, and added exceptions for steam exe, game exe, and anticheat launch exe10. Sacrificed 100 vestal virgins on mount Olympus! (based on EA recommendation)11. Ran the game, I got a message that admin access is required, and to click ok to apply it, once I did anti cheat showed up for the first time and updated.12. Publicada el 14 de noviembre de 2022
																Some improvement over the last edition I played (2021), but the biggest edge hasn't been smoothed. Probably my last EA soccer game.FrostbittenThe game's biggest strength has also been it's biggest weakness for years. The Frostbite engine has put in place hundreds if not thousands of flexible animations which allow play to branch at every possible angle creating beautiful, dynamic gameplay. The cost for this is the game putting ~5 yard radius force-fields around players immediately on the ball making closing down players incredibly and unnecessarily difficult. The close down option is insufficient for higher level play and using the jockey button sends you out of position if the ball handler does pretty much anything (I think the game assumes that you were ♥♥♥♥♥ out by whatever they did, even if they slightly changed pace in the direction that you are going).Player Career ModePlayer career mode still has issues. I had my controller disconnect mid-match. When I reconnected, the game assumed that I switched teams and prevented any achievement progress. Much worse, the camera stopped acknowledging my existence to instead focus only on the ball. The team I was playing for also loved swapping my position mid-play (Could be minute 80, could be minute 25). While poor form in itself, the fact that nothing on screen acknowledged the change caused confusion and multiple out of position rating deductions. It is not uncommon for this to happen multiple times in a game, adding a layer of frustration and paranoia to my favorite game mode.Miscellaneous Feel BadsLaunching the game feels like a chore with the long anti-cheat pre-load section which also triggers multiple system yes/no alert prompts. The UX also feels unresponsive at times with the UI sometimes waiting seconds between user action and any on-screen acknowledgement (Audio or visual). Not sure if this is because the UI is trying to process and show too much information or if there is a threading issue, but the UI is too slick looking for the game to not at least trigger a sound effect when the user performs a menu action.Bright SpotsThere are some bright spots. The menus continue to get prettier and more streamlined. When the force-fields are down, there is a lot of fun to be had in the close quarters dueling, especially on offense. The overall gameplay continues to feel a bit more fluid. Making money relevant in player career mode as well as having personality choices are a welcome change, even if they don't seem to have much of an effect on play.It's TimeI have enjoyed the game for decades, but fighting against both the other team and the engine to play good defense continues to be a very frustrating experience. It's been an issue for years, and it's not changing in any meaningful way. Couple that with the menu and career issues and playing the game becomes tiring. I'm exhausted. I'm done. It was a good run, but goodbye FIFA/EA Sports FC. I think it's time that I move on.

																I only buy FIFA games (or any yearly sports game 2k etc.) a few years apart to get updated gameplay and graphics. I only play for the single-player career, and the last FIFA I played was 21.From what I have played, the game shouldn't have been released.From the start there was a huge issue. Getting the game to start. I had to edit certificates to get past the "EA AntiCheat Launcher is already running" message.Great, got the game to start (after a few goes). Now the background in the menu is black. I did a quick search to see the menu should have some graphics. The only way I managed to get the background graphics was to cancel connecting to the online services, then once in the menu reconnect. Weird bug, but okay, it doesn't effect gameplay, but still disappointing that the menu is broken.The gameplay itself wasn't too bad aside from the occasional frame drops and stutters. It handled similarly to previous FIFAs I had played, with changes to the set-pieces and career progression. It was alright for playing as a midfielder. A keeper on the other hand, no chance. The camera angle is way to high so you can't see the play develop at the edge of the box which is un-fixable to my knowledge and the inputs for saves seemed unresponsive at times, for the most part, a miserable time.Minor other bugs crept in that made me request a refund and go back to FIFA21. An example being when a goal is scored in another game. The commentary is fine but the graphic isn't. The background shows up but the text/images (showing player, team and score) just didn't appear. A simple feature that was fine in previous instalments just didn't work. It's a minor thing, but something that irked me.I tried to push through the issues, but there's only so much broken content that is acceptable.

																Jujur secara grafik dan gameplay-wise game ini sangat bagus walaupun terkesan tiap tahun selalu merilis tittle baru dengan engine yang kurang lebih sama dan hanya penerapan sedikit fitur-fitur baru.Tapi yang paling mengecewakan dari keseluruhan dan menu utama dari game ini adalah mode Fifa Ultimate Team (FUT). FUT ini bisa kadang menyenangkan bisa kadang membuat anda stress dan gila. Yes, benar-benar gila, Ada beberapa moment dimana anda dapat mengalahkan team yang berisi icon-icon legendaris dan juga ada sebuah moment dimana anda kalah dengan sebuah team yang anda saja bisa tertawa melihat formasinya, seakan game ini sudah ter scripted kapan kita menang dan kapan kita kalah, bukti nyatanya adalah bagaimana shoot anda yang begitu medium bisa sangat kencang dan mengenai tiang, atau bahkan pemain anda yang hanya diam melihat bola ketika ada peluang kecil saja yang bisa di manfaatkan, tetapi pada suatu moment pemain anda juga bisa melakukan tendangan atau umpan terobosan yang anda sendiri bisa tidak mempercayainya. Game yang katanya fisiknya sangat realistis ini juga bisa menjadi boomerang bagi anda sendiri, ada suatu moment pemain anda dapat menabrak satu sama lain sehingga melepas bola, ada juga moment dimana kiper anda yang seharusnya bisa menangkap bola malah jatuh dan melihat kearah yang sebaliknya ataupun memantulkan bola pelan, sangat tidak logis bagaimana game ini sedemikian rupa di setting untuk menyenangkan dan membuat anda frustasi dalam waktu yang sudah ditentukan. Anda dapat diberikan musuh divisi rendah secara 8 kali beruturut-turut sampai akhirnya anda diberikan musuh dengan pengalaman bertahun-tahun selama seminggu penuh bermain, belum lagi dengan banyaknya cheater-cheater yang ada mulai dari pengguna BOT dan juga Invisible team yang hampir setiap hari akan anda temui.Jujur ini merupakan tittle FIFA pertama dan terakhir yang saya beli dikarenakan, ya untuk apa main game sampah ini lebih baik saya mengurus hidup saya dan menyelesaikan pekerjaan saya daripada tiap hari memikirkan pemain saya dengan rating yang dibuat sangat tinggi namun sangat sampah saat dimainkan. Terimakasih

Publicada el 29 de octubre de 2022
																[DISCLAIMER: This review is subject to change or have things added/removed over the course of increased playtime] FIFA 23: A disappointing sequel Among the abundance of football games, FIFA has taken the stage and become one of the most popular and prominent over the past decade. With releases coming every single year, it is to be expected that EA would release updates and changes to gameplay, graphics, interface, squad updates, and many more. But after trying FIFA 23 for a couple of hours, I have to say i'm quite disappointed with the lacking amount of new content that they have brought under the immense price tag. In this review i'll be highlighting some cons and pros that i've found whilst playing this game (mainly player career mode and a little bit of FUT) in which i'll start with the pros. PROS  1. Graphics:  In this sequel of FIFA, i found that the graphics have been updated substantially and personally looks better compared to FIFA 22. The players, which are highlighted most of the time, look more human-like and natural which is a really good improvement and when combined with updated animations help with enhancing an immersive gameplay. 2. Gameplay:  From a gameplay perspective, the way the players move and control the ball has also been improved and feels much more natural and smooth. The sense of 'weight' is also much better compared to FIFA 22 and overall ball control as well as dribbling feels realistic. The addition of a new shot called the 'Power Shot' also gives a new alternative way of finishing the ball, although this move substitutes the driven shot/downward header which uses the same input (L1 + R1). 3. Content:  Women's football clubs has also been added into the game, though the current state only provides us with clubs from 2 countries (England and France). New content for player career is also a nice addition such as player personalities and decisions such as making investments, buying items, and interactions with your manager, teammates, as well as the press which could alter your personality and result in some consequences in the 'News' section (This is only true for the 'interactions' type of decisions). As for FUT, I haven't played much of it but the new 'Moments' mode is also great.It is safe to note that i've only clocked around 26 hours at the moment of writing this review, so there could be changes made to the pros section of the review. Cons   1. Content - Player Manager - Decisions:  As someone who plays FIFA 23 mostly for its career mode, the new changes added to this section of the gameplay feels 'half-baked' and lacking. As i mentioned earlier, in FIFA 23 you can make decisions which could alter your personality, but this isn't paired with a 'relationship' status with the respective side when you are making your decisions. An example of this would be on a decision that appears when your manager has a poor rating (don't exactly know why, could be because of unfulfilled objectives on his side) which presents you with 3 decisions; 1 is to gossip about it, 1 is to talk with the manager, and the last one i forgot but i think it's along the lines of ensuring the manager that you and the team are behind him to give support. If you were to choose the first decision, a news headline would appear featuring your player talking to the press about the manager's poor performance. Obviously this is very likely to deteriorate your relationship with the manager, but despite picking the first decision your Manager Approval Rating would just stay where it would be before the decision.The lack of correlation between decisions and relationships with the people around you makes the game feel shallow and leaves the player lacking a representation of real-life actions and consequences. 2. Content - Player Manager - Contracts and Transfer Requests:  Despite adding decisions to the player career mode, one aspect that EA has forgotten about is how contracts and transfer requests are conducted. Contracts are real-life agreements done between the player (and agent) with the club representative to ensure the length of time the player is going to be staying and the club, as well as wage and bonuses received. In FIFA 23 I have found 0 interaction with the manager in terms of contract renewal or transfer requests, and the only way to increase your wage is through the decisions tab and even then you'd have to reach a specific Player Overall in order for the decision to be available. Worst of all, the wage is already set automatically so there's no further way of increasing it other than moving to a better club.Transfer requests are a joke, you basically press a button in the 'Squad Hub' which is 'Request Transfer'. This would then prompt the manager to talk to the board on whether or not they should let you move. Often times if you're a star player of the team they would decline, but after repeatedly asking for a transfer they'll accept it. Once you get a transfer offer from another club, they'll just give you a contract with a fixed wage amount. No negotiations, no bonuses. 3. Content - Player Manager - Other interactions:  One other thing i found lacking was the absence of player suggestion for tactics used by the manager. There is no way you, as the player, could contribute towards improving the team's tactics in order to excel in games. Often times i find it hard to attack with the current tactic used and I wish there was just a way to change it by giving suggestions to the manager.

Publicada el 30 de septiembre de 2022
																I want to like it, but I am just a thumbs down right now.  I am not sure I will like it better than FIFA22, but it is still early. (tldr) Decent, IT IS VERY FLAWED IN PLACES.  I play single player FUT, tournaments, and leagues "offline." I play some couch friendlies but rarely play other players.  I tried a few times in FIFA23 and they disconnected, which is fine, I only do it for the objectives.  FIFA22 was my first FIFA game.  By the end I was able to play with a 96 / 100 team on Ultimate against ~70 / 50 opponents, and 96 / 100 like mine at professional or sometimes world class with about 75% win rate.FIFA 23 I have a 84 / 33 team right now, since i used up all my loans except one.  I can win against same level teams on semi-pro almost all the time, but struggle with pro still.So knowing my play style:Here goes my pro/con laundry list:+ Harder than FIFA 23 - Players of FIFA 22 will miss how you could just build a glass jaw speed team and run all over the AI.  Not any more.  I think this is more realistic.  No more screenshots of 18-0 matches on ultimate against the AI (for now at least).++ World cups for M & W will be in there - update: they really havent done much with this+ more women teams than before - any time there are more teams, it is better.+ 2000-ish more players, and the teams they play on are current again.  I had the Madrid 95 Bale up to my last day of FIFA22.+ Leagues and building tournaments seems better in 23.  More options imho anyway.<> Trainers are a little deeper with more options<> Ted Lasso - cool, but not a huge factor<> hypermotion - hype more than anything else<> more trainer options, which is useful when you are new to the game<> more stadiums - looking forward to seeing Boca's stadium in there<> Juventus is now actually called Juventus.  I didnt really care that much when it was a Calcio.  The players were the same...<> Chemistry - I like it and I hate it.  Plenty of spicy comments out there for those who look at other message threads.- Anticheat - because it is buggy- video optimizing.  CPU and GPU will get crushed om the 'optimized settings' for your computer. RAM might too, but I have an I7 9700K, 3070TI, and 128GB RAM, so I notice the CPU and GPU much more than the RAM.  YMMV.- market places are still out of whack, but they seem to always be more costly for stuff in PC market than consoles.  Maybe this will be fixed with the market syncing, but it is too early to tell.- BRA national team still fake players but actual kit which is just weird- Liga MX and JLeague are not in 23 because of PES and Konami exclusive licensing.- Idiotic sub suggestions and way too many of them.  I can probably just turn them off, but if you use it, know they are not great as of this writing.X-X- Card happy referees - I play the same way I did in FIFA22 which is against the AI and pretty aggressive.  1-2 yellows in FIFA22 per match; in FIFA 23 2-3 yellows and quick to the straight red.  That is annoying as hell...  Especially when the AI will do pretty much the same thing and it is "a brilliant if meaty tackle."  I had a guy get flipped over by a kick in the nuts and the AI didnt even get a foul.I bought the Ultimate version, so I started playing at 9PT on 27th Sept and have about 300 hours in so far.I played FIFA 22 for like 300 hours, so I know I will get my money's worth out of it, with my goal always to pay about USD$1 for 1 hour of play.4/10 so far, hoping it will evolve into something that isnt so bad..  7/10 is where I would put FIFA22.

It'll be a very similar experience outside of the updated kits and rosters, which there are probably already mods for. Oh yeah, and did I mention? This game is not only almost unplayable offline without modding, the anticheat will practically attempt to murder you if you try to use mods for career mode or kick off.
