Publicada el 23 de noviembre de 2022
																Disclaimer, This review is based on FUT and it's a long one.New patch made this game utterly shambolic, let me explain why...Pre-patch this game required some kind of skill and it was a refreshing change from previous years, the game was much slower, you had to think about playing the right pass, positioning your defenders to stop the attackers wasn't completely AI based, there was some manual work required and the good players made this game a nightmare for the casuals as they'd break you down slowly and always have the players in the right positions etc.There was a meta like every Fifa, players who had the "Lengthy" accele-rate style did shine and it was basically the Haaland and Ronaldo show, anyone who was tall/strong was usually the threat and nearly all teams you'd play would have tall/strong players. Almost sounds like real life football, huh?However on the 17th November, EA released the dreaded patch we all knew was coming.Post-Patch, they changed it so the other two accele-rate types were quicker, however they broke it, imagine my surprise... Every single player apparently has 99 sprint speed now, apart from your defenders, who of course have gone back to the style 3 years ago where they stand around clueless and watch the likes of Jonjo Shelvey burn past them and applaud him on the way past.This in turn means every single game is basically a game of who's 99 sprint speed player can make the run behind the defence for you to lobbed through ball it the most for 90 minutes. For reference, most if not all my games pre-patch i'd end with low scorelines, 1-1, 2-0, etc, now you're lucky if you don't concede 5 when you win and i'm not even exaggerating. The positioning your players thing i mentioned earlier? Yeah, that's gone too. AI takes over the entire defence and if you lock your player onto a CDM/CM, you needn't worry about defending, the game will do it for you. It's almost like playing Call of Duty with an aimbot, there's no manual skill involved.The custom tactics are also broken, a tap of the button and you can set your team up to sit on the goalkeeper and counter when the AI eventually reclaims possession. If you don't like that style, don't worry, there's another one where you can set your players onto the other team like rabid dogs. Hunting them down relentlessly with constant pressure, no time or space for your opposition to make a pass if you do lose the ball. Now you're probably thinking, but surely either of these custom tactics must wear the players out after 10 minutes of running solidly, you know, like in real life when a team applies loads of pressure and have to take their foot off the gas? Alas, you'd be wrong, usually by the 70th minute you notice the other team is lacking stamina, but don't worry, they just throw on 5 subs and refresh half the outfield team to continue harassing you.This might sound like i'm being an elitist, but i'm really not, i'm sitting around Div 2, which i think is quite respectable, I'm a good player, but i'm not great, the new patch has basically given casual players a huge helping hand and basically eliminated any kind of competitive skill advantage. They've levelled the playing field for everyone by breaking their own game and it's not a good thing.

Publicada el 6 de octubre de 2022
																FIFA 23 has the best gameplay in years, and it features some of the most realistic play to date. Players move and feel more realistically than they ever have.This is a shame, because the gameplay is hidden behind the single most buggy and broken game to date. Many people cannot even get onto the game, because of the new EA Anticheat. Furthermore, many who can get on the game suffer from huge FPS drops and lag in game. The game crashes constantly, and has a multitude of random bugs which massively inhibit the experience. I have played every game mode a little since launch, and each has its own bugs and quirks which make the game much less enjoyable.In Pro Clubs, sometimes you have to force-close the game at the end of a drop-in because it just won't take you out of the game. If you finish a game with your club, you can't use the "next match" button or it will crash everyone in the lobby. In Career Mode, you have to watch the "sold player" animation every single time someone leaves, and the interview questions are just wrong. Reporters asking why my team has lost to a team twice in a season, despite it being the first game of the season. In Ultimate Team, you (STILL) get randomly booted while completing SBCs, doing draft matches, or a any normal FUT activities.I have played a lot of Volta in order to get XP for my pro clubs character. That has randomly stopped giving me much XP, and I have yet to find any explanation as to why. They also have not improved Volta at all since they removed some of the features a couple years ago.With EA Anticheat, they have effectively neutralized the modding community, which has for years kept career mode and offline modes interesting. There is no reason for EA Anticheat to be needed for everything on FIFA, especially as half of the game is completely offline. An "offline-launch" mode without EA Anticheat would be so simple to add, and there is no good reason for it to not be included.And the worst part is there really is no guarantee that any of this will get fixed. EA have proved for years they don't really care about the PC community. This is absolutely the best game in the past half-decade and it seems they could not bother play-testing the PC port.Edit, as of 12/29/22:I think it's important to keep this updated throughout the game's lifespan.The praise I originally had for the gameplay is no longer valid. They have changed it quite a lot. Where a lot of players were usable before, this is no longer the case. It's back to the sweatfest it was last year. Each year, EA artificially turn the speed of the game by 10%, and gameplay often doesn't effectively change all too much. This usually means that players who are 25% faster than others are still 25% faster, and thus pace is the most important stat year after year. In the couple months of this year's game, this wasn't the case. But, they patched the game and honestly the gameplay feels no different to last year's. So, the game's one redeeming quality has been eliminated.The anticheat has been fixed for the most part, and I believe modders have realized the game really doesn't care if you alter files, so modding remains intact.Unfortunately however, a lot of the bugs and flaws I had pointed out previously still stand, and some new ones have popped up. There's a lot of different ways for the game to soft-lock still, so you have to restart it every time and wait for EA AC to initialize every time. You're constantly treading a tight-rope of whether or not the game will cooperate with you.The only positive for this game is the amount of content for Ultimate Team. There's a lot to do, and it's more accessible than ever. However, this often means having to hop into an online match which is, 9 times out of 10, very much not enjoyable.This game, for me, has a lot of failed potential. I had a lot of hope for this game, as I actually enjoyed playing it for the first time in years. It's a shame that the enjoyment I had was so short-lived.

I'm highly suspicious that there is an algorithm present within Ultimate Team that affects the player where your players are just all of a sudden a little slower and clumsy. What does the player tend to think when certain players start becoming not good? time to replace them. Time to rebuild. Time to spend. The game itself is highly addicting. I don't think games like this should be legal, I think ultimately it is predatory. Never mind the loot crate mechanic, but just look at the core design of this product. I don't want to call it a game, because, it's not really. Are you a single player?Career mode is a lot of fun with mods. Mods that enhance realism. Ever since I started playing FIFA on PC (FIFA15) I was running mods, and just could not play vanilla gameplay ever again. Modded career mode is a lot of fun, if you're into that. Vanilla career mode, however, is also bugged and not great. EA haven't given it any meaningful attention in years. You still get players like Haaland going to Birmingham City or whatever. We all like football, it's why we play these games. However this product is designed to play with you, and it's just an awful experience overall.

Publicada el 26 de diciembre de 2022
																Technical IssuesIf you buy this game you might not be able to start it like the majority of people as you will see in other reviews. In order to start this game you will firstly need to enter your BIOS, on your high end PC, and change some settings, which if you don't know what you're doing can be extremely risky to the health of your PC. And from then on you will need to uninstall and re install EA's anti cheat on every start up of this game. Once in game you'll find that despite your ultra expensive custom high end PC, the menus are extremely laggy and unresponsive. If you want to tab out of this game, be sure that when you tab in, to move your mouse cursor to the very top right of your screen and out the way, because this game cannot disable the mouse while playing so if the mouse is hovering over a certain menu icon, and you try to navigate with your controller instead, the game will simply bug out. So just from a technical stand point this game is already atrocious.Gameplay IssuesThe game should be advertised as arcade, not the hyper realistic game it markets to be with all these new motion captures, ball physics etc that mislead. The gameplay is arcade, plain and simple. Remember FIFA matches being 5/6 mins a half, by default. Well this time the default is now 3 minutes a half, why? Because any longer, even on the highest difficulty, the score of the match will be 7-7 and you will be fighting against the game just to keep the score down to actually feel a sense of realism. Dribbling is so stupid I can't even put it into words, players are on ice here, no studs in the ground, every player has 1000 agility, because the way they chop and turn and dribble makes no sense, not even Messi can dribble like this in real life, and this is amplified against the AI on any high difficulty, you will not get the ball for at least 2.5 minutes of the 3 minute half because their dribbling is simply uncontrollable.Career ModeWe all know career mode has been on the decline in forever, which every new feature either breaking the game or being pointless, the dynamic sim feature where you watch dots play like its FM needs so much work, its so bare bones and you will always need to jump in to save your side losing. The new highlight mode is complete garbage with only having a select few highlights, so once you've seen and played a few, you've played them all, and the scenarios get extremely repetitive because of this. Transfers get a transfer rating and whoever rating your business literally has 0 business sense, and you'll likely get sacked for making good business, not to mention you can't loan players out because every loan offer is a loan to buy with a stupid price that can't be negotiated without the deal falling through. All in all another stinker for career mode.OnlineI never got round to playing online as I spent all of my short time in this game troubleshooting and trying to fix the offline game play with various slider settings. But I can imagine the arcade feel of this game translates well to an online simplified experience where you do ridiculous skill moves and score plenty of goals. FUT mode is absolutely packed with features and I would recommend this mode if you have plenty of money you want to spend on getting the best players and items.ConclusionI have played FIFA all my life, since FIFA 2004, growing up with the game, buying it every year and without fail playing hundreds of hours. FIFA 17 onwards my hours declined as did the game, but it was still playable up until this release. I can't understand how this game was even able to release in the technical state its in and I genuinely can't believe the huge decline this franchise has gone on over the past half a decade. I'm extremely disappointed. But this game really shows EA for what they are, with extreme amounts of income, can't even spend on the resources to make this game actually playable, its a complete ripoff of all its fans and the kids that spend serious amounts of money on FUT every year, and everyone who has bought this game year in year out faithfully to play career mode.Utter disaster, don't purchase this game.0/10

																Don't waste your money... the game doesn't even launchUpdate:Highly recommend not purchasing through steam as i have found numerous issues, however i have now sorted this, seems to be a compatibility issue unsure if it is with windows 11 or across the board with OS.Hope this solution helps those who have already purchased:After downloading right click on game title - open file location - install/update EAAntiCheat.GameServiceLauncher, right click on EAAntiCheat.GameServiceLauncher.dll, click digital signatures, view certificate, install certificate, ok.repeat process with file EAAntiCheat.GameServiceLauncher.this should allow game to launch, if like me and screen doesn't adjusted correctly, go back to local files - find FIFA23, right click properties, Compatibility, click disable full-screen optimisations. now launch the game with a controller, run through start up (screen will be constantly trying to minimise, deal with it for a few seconds) scroll to settings, find digital display and set to 1960x1060, the game should now be playable.if you haven't bought the game yet - get it through EA App - Runs better.

																One of the most horrible online experiences ever; this is probably the most defender-sided FIFAs I have ever played, the game will automatically arrange the defending team with TWO rows of defenders in the box if you take too long. The only way to score goals is by through balls, and 90% of the time the center backs (no matter how slow) will outpace you. Interceptions are extreme, and so are offsides (the game will automatically position your attacker offside even without the need for your opponent to enable offside trap), goalkeepers make hilariously cartoonish saves like superhuman jumps and reacting to a ball the speed of a car being shot point blank. All of this is unless you use certain cards like Kylian, Jairzinho, Flashback Havertz, Al-Owairan, Van der Sar, Alisson, Ederson, etc; which you will inevitably see every game once you reach Division 3. Sure all of this nonsense applies to the opponent as well and you can even exacerbate the issue by playing 0 depth with Drop Back tactics or if you spam the extremely overpowered skill moves that are basically the equivalent of fighting game specials minus any sort of recovery frames but it becomes a snoozefest. It honestly offers nothing to a newcomer, the online portion game is made for addicts of the series that are down to put up with the classic EA balancing for the sake of furthering their addiction. The offline game modes can bring you HOURS of fun especially with mods, and while they are riddled with the filth that is DDA just like every single EA product, it can be fun and has been what I have done to somewhat justify my purchase; however, it is still not worth it, especially at full price.TL;DR, this game is riddled with gameplay modifiers that work both ways but make the game extremely boring and unrealistic, only buy for offline game modes and for a heavy discount.

Publicada el 11 de octubre de 2022
																Probably the worst FIFA to date if I'm going to be perfectly honest (which is really saying something). So if you're just wanting a quick yes or no answer to the question of "Should I buy this FIFA?". The answer is  ABSOLUTELY NOT  Now, for a more in depth look as to why I whole heatedly recommend you stay away from this FIFA (In it's current state), look no further than the points below. Gameplay The passing feels extremely weak compared to recent iterations, which makes possession play unnecessarily difficult to maintain and one of the more ineffective play-styles. Crossing is also just terrible this year (not that is was very good last year either, but they've somehow made it worse), since it either goes straight to the keeper, or the cross is too weak / powerful to be effectively received by the target man. So, what does this leave us with? We can't play fluid passing football and we can't play crosses from the wings. Well as you probably have guessed, this leaves us with aggressive counter attacking football from one end to the other, and while this is certainly a fun play-style for some players, not everyone wants to play that way and not every team is built to play this way. Just as with IRL football, not every game should be finishing 5-4 on average because that's just not how it works. This isn't Sunday League, it's professional football. Yes there are plenty of games that have had ridiculous scorelines IRL, but not every single game! And as stated before, this happens due the fact that this FIFA doesn't support any other type of play-style than end to end aggression. Oh and on top of all of this, set pieces have had an overhaul, which I'm personally not the biggest fan of either. I don't know why they changed the corner system when it has worked well for the last few years with few complaints from the wider community. Free Kicks I somewhat understand, but again they've just gone against the idea of "If it isn't broken, don't fix it" which ironically has made it broken in typical EA fashion.  Performance  So this is where I really lose my patience with EA, because not only is the PC Port atrocious, but it  STILL  has some core issues that have been a factor since FIFA 19 (And maybe even earlier because FIFA 19 was the first FIFA I played on PC after switching from console). Why oh why do I need to turn on VSync via NVIDIA Control Panel for this game to even run at a slightly acceptable level of performance. Why does the game start dying from the inside and begin stuttering uncontrollably the moment it passes 60 FPS? And to this question, one might reply "If going past 60 FPS is an issue, just turn on the frame limiter in the FIFA settings", but oh no wait a second, THE ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ FRAME LIMITER DOESN'T EVEN WORK! And as I said earlier, this exact issue has been a thing since at least FIFA 19... 4 different games have been released since then and this issue still persists on the most recent release. How little must you care about your fan base that you don't even fix a frame limiter... It actually blows my mind that this level of disrespect is even possible. But it doesn't even end there, because my makeshift fix of VSync doesn't fix every single cut-scene in the game from running at like 18 FPS whether it be on the pitch, in manager career mode or even some random bloke walking into the stadium before the game. FIX YOUR ♥♥♥♥ EA, for crying out loud this is just stupid.  Online Play  I haven't played all that much online yet, mainly because the performance combined with the lag just hurts my eyeballs and makes me want to stop playing, so I will update this section once I've fully descended into the pits of Hell.  EA Anti Cheat  I'm not going to dwell on this section for too long since there's not really much I can say that you probably haven't already read by the time you've seen this review, but the long and short of it is EA Anti Cheat bad (It enjoys preventing people from accessing the game at all, and is probably the root cause of my aforementioned performance issues)  Final Thoughts  All in all this game is just a huge middle finger to the PC community and is probably EA's way of throwing a tantrum because they lost the rights to FIFA for next year's release. I won't lie to you though, there are some good parts to this game, they're just so few and far between that I can't make an entire section dedicated to them so I will quickly list them here: 1. Career Mode has had some extra love put into it for once, which I personally really appreciate2. The game engine (when it isn't stuttering like Jimmy from South Park), looks beautiful 3. Tackling feels so strong and responsive. 4. It's cool to see Women's Club Football added So yeah, those are the only 4 good things I could think of with my time spent within FIFA 23 so far. Everything else is a car crash. Speaking of car crashes, there's another sports brand that EA Sports has recently acquired the full rights to, and funnily enough their most recent release has also been one of the worst in the series... Cough Cough F1 22. I think that honestly speaks for itself. At the end of the day, it is my fault that I keep buying these games every year since I know what to expect from EA, but of course there are no alternative football games even worth mentioning right now, so I guess I am stuck with this burning heap of poo for the next year. Here's hoping the FIFA Licence gets picked up by a company that actually has passion and cares for their fans. Oh also, no disrespect to Derek Rae, but #BringBackMartinTylerTheGOAT

Publicada el 26 de octubre de 2022
																Pros:- Non-pace centric gameplay and responsive goalkeeper and tackles although it feels like they discontinued it according to the last games I've played.- New mechanics such as power shot- Minor updates on career mode- Discontinuation of old team chemistry system in FUT- 5 substitutions availableCons:- Terrible optimization, fluctuations between 10-30 fps on a high-end PC.- 90% of players are clunky, rest will just dance around your team.- Camera angles are terrible and you stare in a blank spot of the stadium after each cutscene and takes 5-10 seconds to actually see where the freekick is happening. If you are playing with a friend you look at the game through their camera during freekicks disabling you to position yourself. - There is always one defender waiting inside your goal to save opponent from an offside call.- Terrible AI. They dont react to a ball moving next to them unless you take control. Goalkeeper rushes out of the goal in a straight direction independent of the direction the ball is in or going.- Terrible referee calls. Last defender kills the player going for goal and receives a yellow card while you push a player just a little too hard and receive a red. Game ends precisely when the extra time expires regardless of where you are positioned and potential of your attack.- Skill moves are pretty much useless.- Players outside the top 5 leagues didnt receive any attention from EA once again. Only upgraded if they are young or downgraded if they are getting old.- Probably the worst soundtracks I've ever heard in a Fifa game. - Different UI but same gameplay in career mode.- New chemistry system feels like it provides you more freedom but its restricted with options on the position your players can play. For example a striker can have ST as main position and can also play as CAM. Other than these predefined positions, wherever you put your player, he will receive 0 chemistry bonus and you need to spend position modifiers for every minor formation changes.- If your opponent disconnects while you are winning, you'll not receive a win 90% of the time. Instead it says game will be investigated which never happens and you never receive the win. But if you get disconnected for some server problems you'll surely receive a loss.- Shoot, cross and pass assistances always make the worst decisions even if its semi-assistance. Need to work on your manual gameplay.- There is nothing special or fun about FUT moments.- No addition to the cosmetics of the stadium in FUT compared to last year.Overall I am not happy with my purchase. Although I was excited with the new features, they are left in the shadow of fundamental problems. Eventually they will fix it up to some point but that point is always a mistery and you can never know in which way the gameplay will evolve. I'd say wait for december and buy it for 50% off as the gameplay will be more balanced and fundamental issues will be better than what it is now. At this moment it feels like not having a competitor in the genre gave them the confidence of releasing an unfinished game. I still find some moments to enjoy it since I like football and the franchise but whenever I close the game all I feel is grief.

Publicada el 16 marzo
 FIFA 23: 4/10 77.2hrs played (as of 16/03/2023).February last year, I reviewed FIFA 22 (in a lot more detail than this post) and gave the game a 7/10, by which point, I had amassed around 270hrs of game-time. To summarise, I really enjoyed the game, and I was happy getting it for the price I did, plus I was able to mod the game properly to add another level of enjoyment to the game. So, for me, it is disheartening to have to give this year's instalment of FIFA a 4/10 just down to its sheer unplayability.Just to elaborate, I am a career mode player, I sometimes play the FUT gamemode however, I prefer to play and rebuild clubs / take clubs to European glory. I always find a sort of satisfaction in building up a team.The 'major' feature this year that I was looking forward to was the fact that career mode would now allow you to use faces of real managers; for me it opened up new avenues to make the game more interesting. I admit, regardless of this update I could have done them such as picking a manager and using their style to win everything. However, for me, it added authenticity.Moving on, in terms of the general gameplay I do enjoy it, I think the new defending mechanic being able to mark undefended opposition really can add more difficulty to the game, alongside with a noticeable change to player speed. I think it really changes the dynamic of the game and I do enjoy that. However, the main issue that I have is the performance.I currently use a MSI GF63 Thin laptop, built with a GeForce 1650Ti GPU, i7-10750H, and 16GB RAM; on paper, I should be able to run the game with no problem, as long as the graphics are set correctly. But, this just isn't the case. I can crack out 40-60FPS during the game but, after some time playing (it varies how long) I will experience really bad choppiness in the frames. In particular, cut scenes, such as scoring a goal or when the camera pans to the crowd, the game really struggles to get through. I have tried absolutely everything I know to make the game more playable but, it just does not work. For that reason, I have to give the game a 4/10 as it is just not fun to play when you have frame drops every few minutes.Weirdly, KO and FUT do not have this same problem, I imagine it being down to games in FUT being done remotely through a server (taking off the initial load from the player's device) but, I can't fathom it.Unless there is some sort of optimisation to the game, I can't really recommend this to others. I know other people (with better equipment) have been having similar issues so it doesn't seem to just be contained to my PC.

Publicada el 5 abril
																This is the most inconsistent game I've ever played. It will make you question your computer, your controller, your internet connection, your skill, everything. In the end, you are not the deciding variable, but their inconsistent, overloaded servers are. The game will go from brilliant, fluid gameplay to Messi feeling like a truck that cannot turn in the span of hours. Unfortunately, it is bad gameplay 9 out of 10 times. And not even that is consistent, it's impossible to build any kind of muscle memory in this game. The funny thing is, because of how the architecture of the game, not just your controlled player will feel delayed, no even your AI players won't react to anything anymore. And apart from the server inconsistencies, there have been countless discussions about dynamic difficulty adjustments, where one team's players suddenly forget how to play football to make the game more thrilling and "dynamic", i.e. less predictable. As someone with over 1000 hours combined on Steam and the EA App, it is 100% existing in this game, the gameplay is NOT always the same, it adjusts depending on how EA wants. That does not mean that good players won't still win, but EA makes their task just a tiny bit harder. It's also not a valid excuse to lose a game. Frankly, to many players it's not even about winning or losing anymore, they just want consistent gameplay. I've won countless matches I didn't deserve to win, and that doesn't feel great, it sucks for both me and the opponent. If EA can produce a football game that is running on a solid server architecture which produces consistent gameplay, we might have a brilliant game here. If the game runs well, it is extraordinary, the most complete football simulation I ever played, miles better than games that ran on previous gen. It is A TON of fun, which makes it so frustrating that we only get glimpses of it then and now.

																Just refunded itShort answer: lack of optimization, bugs (not game breaking buy really annoying), graphics weren't good they looked  oversharpened and not as good as everyone says (at least on my side).Long answer: bearing in mind all the bad reviews it was obvius that it was not a good deal back then but after 6 months i though maybe things changed... Well ofc it didn't, the game just mantains that bad performance/optimization from release till now apparently, graphic options seem to not be working at all, not even the frame rate cap since i had to cap them from the NVIDIA panel just so my gpu doesn't start flying or exploting rendering 1000 frames on the main menu, i tried playing some matches but i got some stutters and some random gpu utilization that didn't really make sense, on cinematics and corner kicks my gpu power would go up to 200-215w causing to ram up the fans to like 4000rpm which is really annoying to hear and to think that not even cyberpunk 2077 did that to my system, i tried changing the graphic settings but to no avail, there was no visual difference and my system was behaving the same way as if i never turned down/up the graphic settings.Got some bugs that were very annoying to the point that i had to restart the game because i couldn't see the menu properly, the background was black and the options were flickering, there was another were the players were all white and so on.I cannot give any positive points about the game since i tried it for like 50 minutes which is not enough to make more conclusions but the only thing that i can conclude is that if you plan to get this game, if possible do it on console because in pc it's pretty rough and its not gonna get better...My specs are RTX 3070, R5 5600X, 16gb ram 3200MHz, my gpu utilization was around 40%-99% and the temps were fluctuating a lot, sometimes i would get 40-48 degrees on 99% utilization and sometimes i would also get 60-65 degrees on 99% utilization which doesn't make sense but any way, just wanted to clarify a bit more about the erratic behavior that this game has on pc, my cpu utilization was at about 40-50% so no complications there i think.So... think twice about getting it, it may perform better or worse on other systems, i've seen some videos on high-end pcs running this game and they suffer for almost the same issues that i've had specially the stuttering issue.

Publicada el 20 enero
																For the love of God, don't buy this if you haven't already. I've sunk 100s of hours into every FIFA since 17, but this year's game is so bad I won't even break 50, in fact I've outright deleted it off my pc. There's always something wrong or bad about a new FIFA game that comes out, but at some point you can get used to it and the game is still somewhat playable, not this time. 23 is just so outright horrid to play, game play is not consistent whatsoever and I can't remember having fun anywhere in the 36 hours I've played.Passing is one of the worst parts of this installment, half of passes that you would think are easily make-able are somehow intercepted and through balls are almost useless, as they'll never go where you aim them or the defender will gain a random boost of pace to somehow catch up to your quick winger/striker. Opposition goalkeepers will save almost anything, even to the point where it looks like they're disobeying the laws of physics (quite literally they'll levitate off the ground without making any jumping motion to reach your shot), all while your goalkeeper will dive the opposite direction of a shot or not fully extend his arms out to make an easy save.I could go on, and on, and on, and on, about how shameful this game is, it's easily the worst in the last 6 years, and that is saying something considering the quality of some of the past installments recently. It's just so bad, it should be considered a crime that I had to pay $76 including the tax, I should be able to sue for that. For the amount of money EA makes off the FIFA games, it's unacceptable they can put out garbage like this and slap a $70 price tag on it. Truth is no amount of money is worth this game, please do something else with that money, don't make my mistake where I wasn't even sure if I wanted it this year but caved in anyways. No chance I get a refund either since I've played over two hours, but this might be the worst money ever spent.I haven't even gone into the bugs and horrible launch of the game, I literally had to mess with settings of my computer's MOTHERBOARD to even be able to launch the game, because apparently some setting in there was switched on that wouldn't allow the game to start, and those types of things are delicate stuff that can mess with your computer if you do something wrong. I also had to go into game files and add a code so the anti cheat wouldn't perform a first time setup every time I opened the game, as in the anti cheat would try to install itself every time I would try to play the game despite it already being downloaded.Also there is 100% scripting/momentum in FIFA, no matter what EA says. I actually believe it's the most blatant in this installment and a huge problem, besides the passing it's probably what frustrated me most, you can easily find proof of this on videos and online.This is literally a warning, do not buy this game, do not buy any of their games, please. They can't keep getting away with this type of stuff. I never write reviews for anything, but I had to this time.

																I got addicted to FIFA in early 2017 and it made the year into the worst one of my life. The time it took away from school work and social interaction is time I won’t get back. Turns out I have grown, in that I recognized that FIFA is bad for me in ten days instead of in one year. I don’t get angry a lot, but playing this game gets me into a primal rage on a daily basis instead of maybe once or twice per year. The highs you get from doing good is heavily outweighed by every time the game misinterprets your inputs or your teammates AI decide to take a nap instead of running for the ball. But the highs get you to come back.If you want to play a good football game, go play Rocket League instead.

																The game is very buggy and unoptimized;Sometimes the game just refuses to launch no matter what, forcing you to restart your machine, which is annoying as hell. Update: try to launch as administrator OR uninstall and reinstall EA anticheat using the installer located in the __Installer folder inside of the game folder, these 2 solutions worked for me.For some reason, sometimes, the game stutters during the middle of the a match and resource usage would spike, effectively making you lose control over your team. The game is generally unoptimized; my GPU would sometimes just jet while being in the MENU. I know for a fact that an rtx 3060 is not so weak that it would struggle to load a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ menu screen. I could play games like rdr2 just fine, but not fifa I guess, for some odd reason.I also wanted to add something else about player career mode, even though I know a lot of people will probably not ever experience this issue due to the unpopularity of the game mode. Sometimes, the match objective screen would just not disappear and block pretty much 50% of your view of the pitch which is really annoying. And you'd need to restart the match to make it disappear.I wouldn't recommend this game, but, I know that I would still buy the next installment because I'm already addicted to this franchise. However, in my opinion, It's not worth your $60. Especially not annually. If you do want to buy it, however, buy it on sale.

All seriousness this feels like the best FIFA game for a while, at least since Fifa 18, but I cannot recommend because of the abysmal online gameplay, every time a cutscene plays, my game lags, I cannot skip this cutscene for whatever reason, so you sit there for 5 mins waiting the cutscene to play out. The defending feels awful, maybe that's a skill issue on my part, but when not controlling defenders they seem to leave other players unmarked and let them through. 																The game is fun, and feels like an improvement from Fifa 22. I like to play manager and career mode a lot and  I really enjoyed the changes they made this year. If you enjoy career mode then this game is worth getting. FUT is the same as it usually is except for the new chemistry system that I personally don't really like. The game play is a little slower but I honestly don't think its as bad as everyone says. I enjoyed the changes and recommend this game to everyone who has enjoyed the previous games. However the game does not like to launch due to the EA anti-cheat. I spent a good hour trying to find a solution to this problem and I finally found something that works for me. here's what worked for me.1. Open task manager and click the steam app and choose "end task"2. Find your steam application on your computer and right click on it and choose "run as administrator"3. Once steam is open, click on Fifa 23 and the game should launch after a few seconds (Might take longer if its your first time running the game)If the game is not running after doing this then try going into the game files and uninstalling the EA anti cheat (Just do a quick google search and follow the videos on how to do this correctly) then re-try the steps above.

It was crazy, I'm not lying, but I haven't played since then except 1 month ago with a friend on PS4 and it was FIFA 2018 and it was just as crazy.Currently I played in the free weekend with a friend and I can say that it is one of the biggest fails of this year. Imagine eFootball (or the former Pes game) only made by Ea Sports. I encountered countless problems with the game, you say that I was playing a play test version in development and I was a game tester. - First of all from the lack of optimization that the game has (I didn't think I would say this with an RTX 2070 in the computer) but yes, I had some gigantic frame drops without being given alt + tab or windows button and then returning back to the game. - Since there was no rendering of the terrain in 3 quarters of the match, I couldn't even play in 2K because the FPS average was no more than 5.- My PC shut down during the game more than 5 times in 3 hours of gameplay and it's the only game I've encountered such a thing. I don't know what the phase is and if this has happened to anyone else or if it's just me who has a defective PC. But actually during the matches, in the menu, in halftimes and many other phases of gameplay, my PC restarts doing absolutely nothing. I don't know how you FIFA players would have reacted if you don't give a pass properly. But if this happens to you, I think you would have thrown the monitor out the window.Conclusion: I do not recommend it, too many FIFA games that appear and nothing changes to say that it is copied after the iPhone. 																Playing football game should be fun, right? Playing FIFA is not.This game gives you a feeling of frustration and understanding that you could spent your time more useful because it feels like you don't control your players.While you can find a lot of people who enjoy FIFA - they enjoy not football but a competition and this kind of satisfaction lies beyond the quality of game itself.FIFA for years is not a football simulator. FIFA is not about understanding football but about understanding how to exploit AI weaknesses.FIFA 23 is a game with hard "meta" that you need to learn if you want to compete with others.Remember it before you make a mistake and buy it.It is nextgen (with HyperMotion) now but old issues still exist:- you will struggle to save settings and key bindings- sometimes FIFA can start to erase your settings/squads/tactics every time you launch the game, showing language/team selection screen. No fix for that still!https://steamcommunity.com/app/1811260/discussions/0/5738182472466513516/https://answers.ea.com/t5/Bug-Reports/FIFA-23-Settings-not-saving/td-p/11891533https://www.reddit.com/r/FIFA/comments/xph7sa/settings_are_getting_reset_every_time_i_launch/- sometimes your controller will disconnect- you can't edit players you've just created, they doomed to stay without mini-faces until you decide to use mods- Matchmaking issues and errors- Liga MX signed with KONAMI so no mexican clubs- Japan league signed with KONAMI so no japan clubs- Part of Serie A signed with KONAMI so fake Napoli, Roma, etc- UI still from FIFA 13 which is pretty boring- FUT UI is old-fashioned console horror with long loading times and no filters you need- You are unable to prepare and use a gameplan (saved formation/tactics/personal instructions) for any team picked in quick matches (not FUT).Imagine, you create your favourite tactics which you want to play, customize roles, etc and then just want to enjoy playing with it for different teams... Well, you can't do it! You'll need to go to settings and load/save it for EVERY team you planning to play.And if you turn on "live squads" (which is needed for updated squads) you will be unable to use your created players or apply your pre-saved game plans so either create it from scratch (for one game) or play with default. EA is so bad in understanding and fixing such obvious things.We, players, know EA for a long time but I couldn't even imagine how they screwed in details which are very important while creating World Cup event in maybe their last game under FIFA branding.Here's an example: I decided to play Croatia - Morocco.A lot of player faces are still generic and look worse than in eFootball 2023, Josko Gvardiol doesn't wear a mask (while masks are available all around Volta football), Vida is in starting lineup of Croatia (while he spent on a bench as veteran the whole WC without even chance to play) and Ivan Perisic is Croatia's captain while in reality it is Modric. -_-FUT changed only in some chemistry mechanics remaining same idiotic DDA-influenced game with horrible UI where you forced to pick players by stats following meta.It's funny that people still enjoy having nearly the same rosters of meta-players pretending they've "created a good team". No need to be original if you want to win in this game.If you like FUT you must get one point - casino owners force you to act as they want, they force you to use players you maybe even don't like. This mode is a casino with created fake values where people dream about same squads, same players, etc It is just disgusting cause the world of football is way more wide than just a bunch of star-players.Now I switch to VOLTA - aside from white adidas arena that make my eyes struggle, mostly arenas are old ones from 22 season updates.Arenas with large football gates were added and this is a complete trash for less chance of teamplay to happen with randoms. In such games I need to skip celebration cutscenes twenty times per game after nearly every taken shot hits the net.At the same time taking shots on small gates now a complete random even by FUT standards!I am pretty well trained in hitting corners exactly WHERE I ACTUALLY POINTED in FIFAs, Volta 22, eFootball 23 and FIFA Online while here i miss shots for no reason. Ball doesn't fly where i point the stick. And sometimes i score where i shouldn't.I've tried different builds, spent all my points for shot accuracy but couldn't get what i do wrong. So probably DDA affects VOLTA gameplay more than it was before.Pretty much disappointed EA still haven't added the ability to create private VOLTA lobbies so we can play with skilled players against each other to make VOLTA football look more like a futsal not like some WWE slam show of kiddos.I really hope EA won't get FIFA license for 24. Let them do their EA Sports FC and challenge with lack of promotion from branding.So I wish that one day we will get nice and enjoyable football game where defending is not a matter of random AI positioning affected by scripts.

I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. 																A little about myself. I've played Fifa Ultimate Team since their first launch (Fifa 10) so 13 years in total give or take. This is probably EA's best Fifa so far. The company has definitely evolved since their beginnings. The graphics are absolutely stunning if you have the privilege to play on a 1440p monitor or higher on all maxed out settings. Long story short I think the game is the opposite of fun when you are playing competitive game modes. I don't want to go in deep detail (even though i probably should when I am making criticism about the game) but it's filled with BS long story short. The more you play the game the more you will see the bs and understand that the game is lacking. Beside the bs which is hard to look past the game is pretty good. None meta players in 22 are finally far far far more meta this year. I LOVE THAT. The game is finally starting to make real life meta players meta in-game unlike 22. Keep it up EA!REVISED REVIEW:Now that EA have updated their game and made the lengthy players nerfed, the non lengthy players are finally meta again. The game is far more fun now imo and I'm definitely enjoying it a lot more. The BS still exist but again the game is now better. Would I recommend this game? Actually I think I would say yes to that.

																I haven't played FIFA since FIFA 18 and, well, it hasn't evolved much has it? Thought I'd give it a go since the next World Cup is on this year's edition, but upon hearing that the World Cup mode on Ultimate Team is going to be intertwined with the normal game mode rather than its (hugely popular) own standalone mode, I'm very dissappointed, but lets see how it goes I guess. So gameplay is 'meh' at best, the keepers dive the wrong way for some shots, long shots floaters that somehow the keeper just can't reach when its within arms reach. But the biggest gripe I have with this game is a GAME BREAKING bug which I have had from day one - Your player will randomly run off in the direction you happened to be attempting to go for a good few seconds at least (like genuinely 3-4 seconds) and this is unbelievebly frustrating since you are HELPLESS for those 4 seconds. You can't switch players, you can't change direction, NOTHING. This happens at least 3 times per game and is simply unacceptable.

Publicada el 17 de octubre de 2022
																There have been next to no tangible improvements to the match engine, seemingly EA spent the entire last year adding in their new power shot feature, which, while a nice addition that somewhat increases the amount of strategy players have to use in the game, doesn't make up for the fact that Player-controlled teams outright cannot defend, and even AI teams can't either sometimes. Often defenders will stand around doing nothing when not being controlled by the player, and in some cases will even move out of a position that needs to be covered to track an attacker's run. Tackling still feels completely useless, as the ball simply gravitates back to the attacker's feet anyway, and acres of space can be found in the box at any time. This leads to absurdly high-scoring games that don't feel real at all, and lack most of the nail-biting tension that makes football exciting. EA look at all the high-scoring games in real life that become instant classics, and think that's what players want in abundance. But It's precisely their rarity that makes them special. By making them common EA is just making them boring. If you're on the fence about whether to buy this game, I would recommend that you don't. As always it isn't sufficiently different from the previous instalment, and if you don't plan on playing Ultimate Team, the features for other game modes are still incredibly shallow.

Publicada el 10 de octubre de 2022
																Everything about FIFA 23 just feels like a miss. As someone who plays 500+ hours of FIFA per year, I'm incredibly disappointed by this installment. Here's my biggest problems with the game: Pacing & Responsiveness FIFA 23 is the least responsive version of FIFA yet. The game is incredibly slow. Through passes are terrible, dribbling is useless, and tackling is all RNG. 90% of the time you make a tackle, it will fall back to your opponent. Gameplay in general feels incredibly mudded, making a simple input feel like an eternity to actually see the effect on screen.  PC Performance Issues Even worse than previous installments, FIFA 23 runs your graphics card at 100%, no matter where in the game you are. You can be sitting AFK on a menu and your bedroom/office will be 90 degrees before you know it. Stuttering issues still carry over into gameplay if you uncap the frame rate with the in-game setting, similar to previous FIFAs on PC. The best thing you can do to play at a higher frame rate and reduce stuttering is cap the game at 190 fps in your Nvidia Control Panel just like you need to do with every EA game.  Cross Platform Cross platform may as well not exist for PC players on FIFA 23. Yes you are able to play games against console players, which is great in finding matches in certain friendly and draft game modes that were previously hard to find an opponent, but the core game modes and gameplay see no benefit to adding cross platform. PC players were even left out of the shared transfer market that even Google Stadia players have access to. The only reason we will be getting cross platform Pro Clubs in the coming months is because of the insane backlash EA got for not implementing it in the first place. Overall, I'm incredibly frustrated with this installment of FIFA. It feels like they tried to half implement all of the buzz words that would make for good marketing, "Cross platform" being one of the biggest. If you aren't addicted like most of us FIFA players, do yourself a favor and skip this installment.

																I bought the Ultimate Edition of the game as I was excited to try my first Fifa since 2019. I'm a huge football (soccer) fan and really fancied getting into a football game for the first time in a few years. I bought Fifa and at least expected some progress... there is none. Sure the game looks better and the animations are improved, but it is still the same underlying game that i did not enjoy in 2019.I thought I would give Ultimate Team a proper go this year, and I did, I played around 12 matches online and did ok. But this is not football, this is an arcade machine, complete with addictive gambling mechanics and the odds stacked massively in favour of the morons who spunk money on microtransactions. The gameplay is abysmal in this mode, it's all about speed, stupid skill moves and it feels nothing like real football.So I thought, how about my favourite mode, career mode. Well it's barely changed at all since I last played, the menus are still abysmal, the scouting is awful, the transfer hub is cumbersome, the same crappy cutscenes and interviews. Then there is the difficulty, on World Class the game is a far too easy but on Legendary every team plays like a top team regardless of rating or level. There is zero depth here, Master League on PES form 2005 had more depth than this crap. It's just not fun to play, which is obviously deliberate to try and funnel people into FUT.Football games are in such a poor state of affairs. There used to be options, but now EA have a monopoly with PES pretty much dead and this is what we get, it's truly awful and I feel ashamed of myself for ever thinking it was a good idea to pay for this. I will not fall for it again and unless something drastic changes to change this monopoly EA have, this is it, games geared towards immoral child targeted slot machines and not a care in the world to try and simulate and respect the greatest sport in the world. I'll stick to Football Manager (which as its own issues with having a monopoly in the market).Oh yeah and last of all... no Steam Deck support? Up yours EA.

																This is by far the worst fifa i have ever played, and i have played FUT since fifa 13. I dont even know where to start. But let me start by saying this is only based on FUT gameplay, since i dont play anything else.The launch it self have been awful, the game for me was delayed by 16 hours before i could play it, even tho i paid 30£ more for "early" access. When it finally became avaliable i then had to troubleshoot for a couple of hours to actually get it running because of the anticheat problem that still stops a lot of people for playing it.This game is trying to melt your pc, i can hear my pc spinning up as soon as i lauch the game, even tho it should not take good hardware to run this. Last fifa i got 350 fps or so in 4K with my RTX 3080TI and a Ryzen 5900X. In FIFA 23 the menus get 82 fps and it stutters like crazy and the gameplay is 120 fps but cutscenes stutter down to 42 fps, it makes no sense, its horrible. You thought this was it? Ooooh no, the game also then randomly minimazing every 2-3 minutes so you have to re enter the game to fullscreen while midgame. Also the mouse cursor shows up every 2-3 minutes messing up controller inputs in the menus. Lets talk gameplay then.What the ♥♥♥♥.I traded my way up to 450k in a couple of days and bought Messi, but. No matter which player you have it will feel like a bronze. There is simple no dribbling in this game anymore, every player is stuck in mud and sliding around on iceskates. Passing is broken and super slow, and dont even try to use a skill move. The only viable option is to not sprint and do X passes. Also every goal from both sides always comes from a random bounce back between tackles. No skill takes place anymore, pure RNG is in control of every single match. The gameplay feels like playing with bad servers with input lag, but there is none. Its the gameplay itself.This is my feeling from this game in around 30 hours, and 45 rivals matches in division 6.My plan for this fifa is simply to keep trading to around 800k so i can sell the coins for around the same price as i bought the ultimate edition and then i can forget about this awful game.If you are still reading this i would appreciate your thoughts if im the only one feeling and having these opinions on the game, im sure im not.Stay away from FIFA 23, look at the review and take my words. And im not just a hater, i got 1500 hours out of FIFA 22 and actually thought it was a decent game in the series.

																This game is a 50/50 for me. I do like the next-gen hypermotion stuff compared to last year's 'old gen' edition on PC.Graphics look fine and gameplay is fine, but nothing to get too excited over if you have 22. That said, performance is a big issue with this game for some reason. I have a PC that can run games like Cyberpunk and Dying Light 2 on the highest settings without FPS issues, but FIFA 23 for some reason has immense stutters from now and then and will for some reason never reach my refreshrate (whether I put it on 60hz, 120hz or 165hz it's always a few fps below that). Also, if you plan on playing FUT, be prepared to be owned. You won't really downrank once you've certain points in Division Rivals, meaning you'll always be matched with insanely good players. It's just demotivating. EA, please bring Offline Seasons back. That ♥♥♥♥ was the bomb. If you really want to buy this game, buy it in a sale and don't give EA those 70 bucks, because that's just ridiculous (Yes, I'm talking to you, EA. Your games are overpriced for what you give us). If you have FIFA 22 and don't really bother with online gameplay anyways, just stick to that and wait for FIFA 24 or something. Adios.

																I've already encountered 2 game breaking bugs, so the negative reviews from other users seems to be warranted. Somehow EA made a worse iteration as years comes by. Played the heck out of FIFA 22 outside of Steam, but it was never this frustating (heck I never encountered a bug in that release or any years prior).1. EA App won't let me launch the game first time around"We couldn't launch your gameUnfortunately, there was a problem launching your game.Please close this window and try again."Yep, the ever-unreliable EA App. Tried everything, spent hours tinkering, none worked. The solution? Wait it out for a day, and randomly it worked!2. Sometimes in match if you set your settings to Fullscreen, the game can randomly kind of "Alt+Tab" you out of the game, when this happens, this will leave the game window unfocused. When you try to refocus on the window (by remaximizing the window or reclicking inside the window). It automatically kicked you out of focus from the window again. Rendering you soft-locked from the match you're currently playing. The solution? You have to close the game window, lose your match progress, then in case of future re-occurence, set your window settings to Borderless Windowed instead of Fullscreen.

																Fifa has always been fun in general, but this Fifa has a lot of bugs and glitches, especially in FUT;1. When you're playing FUT Rivals COÖP vs someone who's alone, while you're winning, the opponent can leave the game and FUT gets confused on who to give the 2nd win (since one side plays COÖP), so most of the time my friend doesn't get the win in this case and the win goes to the opponent who was losing. It's ridiculous.2. There is a game pause glitch, which makes the pause timer and menu disappear so you're basically stuck in the preview screen of the match forever and you're forced to ALT+F4. This way you lose the game too.3. There is an opponent game leaving glitch, that makes you still keep playing until a half is over. The opponent's team gets the 2nd player (blue triangle) on it and you basically are stuck alone in the game the opponent already gave up on. This gives you the win still, in my case it did at least, but it's so annoying. I captured this glitch on OBS, that's how ridiculous it was.4. Goalkeepers are glitchy asf. The opponents score goals they really shouldn't, like the keeper and my players run into eachother etc. and the ball awkwardly goes into the goal. Fix this please it's ridiculous.5. When you have players duplicated, you can't open any packs until you either sell them for 0 coins or are forced to do SBC's, which I hate putting time into. Stop forcing players to do something with items that are not sorted.6. Huge FPS loss during freekicks, corners kicks, penalties, game replays, goal kicks, etc. basically anything that zooms on the player. FPS goes from stable 80fps to almost 20fps, which makes it harder for players to aim or time.7. Additional note after review: I was playing COOP Rivals again with a friend, we were winning 4-1, opponent leaves and we both get no win. Minute 70+-.Besides this, there are sounds or themes missing in the new Fifa's, while they were present in the older Fifa's like Fifa 11 to 15. An example is the crowd audio of Galatasaray, which was accurate before and now it's just random. Can Fifa not put more effort in teams who are outside of the Premier League? England isn't the only country that can play football. You can at least do that for making everyone pay the full game price every single year. It's also funny that there are base game audio's that are not being used in FUT, or being limited on searching things for your stadium or staff in Transfermarkt.

Publicada el 15 de diciembre de 2022
																The biggest fall from grace I have ever seenTechnical IssuesIf you buy this game you might not be able to start it like the majority of people as you will see in other reviews. In order to start this game you will firstly need to enter your BIOS, on your high end PC, and change some settings, which if you don't know what you're doing can be extremely risky to the health of your PC. And from then on you will need to uninstall and re install EA's anti cheat on every start up of this game. Once in game you'll find that despite your ultra expensive custom high end PC, the menus are extremely laggy and unresponsive. If you want to tab out of this game, be sure that when you tab in, to move your mouse cursor to the very top right of your screen and out the way, because this game cannot disable the mouse while playing so if the mouse is hovering over a certain menu icon, and you try to navigate with your controller instead, the game will simply bug out. So just from a technical stand point this game is already atrocious.Gameplay IssuesThe game should be advertised as arcade, not the hyper realistic game it markets to be with all these new motion captures, ball physics etc that mislead. The gameplay is arcade, plain and simple. Remember FIFA matches being 5/6 mins a half, by default. Well this time the default is now 3 minutes a half, why? Because any longer, even on the highest difficulty, the score of the match will be 7-7 and you will be fighting against the game just to keep the score down to actually feel a sense of realism. Dribbling is so stupid I can't even put it into words, players are on ice here, no studs in the ground, every player has 1000 agility, because the way they chop and turn and dribble makes no sense, not even Messi can dribble like this in real life, and this is amplified against the AI on any high difficulty, you will not get the ball for at least 2.5 minutes of the 3 minute half because their dribbling is simply uncontrollable.Career ModeWe all know career mode has been on the decline in forever, which every new feature either breaking the game or being pointless, the dynamic sim feature where you watch dots play like its FM needs so much work, its so bare bones and you will always need to jump in to save your side losing. The new highlight mode is complete garbage with only having a select few highlights, so once you've seen and played a few, you've played them all, and the scenarios get extremely repetitive because of this. Transfers get a transfer rating and whoever rating your business literally has 0 business sense, and you'll likely get sacked for making good business, not to mention you can't loan players out because every loan offer is a loan to buy with a stupid price that can't be negotiated without the deal falling through. All in all another stinker for career mode.OnlineI never got round to playing online as I spent all of my short time in this game troubleshooting and trying to fix the offline game play with various slider settings. But I can imagine the arcade feel of this game translates well to an online simplified experience where you do ridiculous skill moves and score plenty of goals. FUT mode is absolutely packed with features and I would recommend this mode if you have plenty of money you want to spend on getting the best players and items.ConclusionI have played FIFA all my life, since FIFA 2004, growing up with the game, buying it every year and without fail playing hundreds of hours. FIFA 17 onwards my hours declined as did the game, but it was still playable up until this release. I can't understand how this game was even able to release in the technical state its in and I genuinely can't believe the huge decline this franchise has gone on over the past half a decade. I'm extremely disappointed. But this game really shows EA for what they are, with extreme amounts of income, can't even spend on the resources to make this game actually playable, its a complete ripoff of all its fans and the kids that spend serious amounts of money on FUT every year, and everyone who has bought this game year in year out faithfully to play career mode.Utter disaster, don't purchase this game.0/10

																(I play career mode mostly)This Game is absolute dog water. The defense is non existent, the goalkeepers are useless and the attack is god tier.There are no matches where you'll have struggle scoring and same goes for the opponent which means in every game you'll end up with scores like 5-6 or 7-7, pretty terrible attempt at being realistic.The defense doesn't work. They come upfield playing around the halfway line which means you get counter attacked on very easily every time and there's no way to stop since the defense is slower than the attack. The attacker can now shoot anywhere on the goal and will not be stopped because the keeper also just sucks. Playing with an ps4 controller, I have found, to sprint you need to double tap R2 or else with holding R2, the players won't run at max pace.After multiple hours of experimenting with the magnitude of mildly explained settings, I got the game to be a LITTLE BIT better. You shouldn't have to be doing this for a 60$ game.Also, if you click on run game in steam library with your controller connected.  You saves will be wiped out!!!Overall this game is not worth your time and money. It's a chore more than anything. But if you really wanna buy it then I'd say pick it up for less than 10-15$.The game is unbalanced AF!

THE WORST GAME I HAVE EVER PLAYEDDecided to buy this because a friend thought it would be fun to play together.Oh how wrong he was.It started off with me not being able to connect with him through the EA App. You can't find your friends. We made our profiles as public as possible and the EA App would just tell us user not found.I was also not able to start the game at all because I didn't have the correct BIOS settings? There's not a single other game in the world that makes you change your bios settings.Also I had to close every single other program (Rainmeter, MSI Afterburner, Discord etc) otherwise it wouldn't launch.After finding ways around all of that the game finally launched.It's the worst experience i've had in a game so far.Every game ends with a ridiculous score like 8-7.You also get one half of the game where your players seem to know what they're doing. The other half of the game they are crippled kids with two left feet. This leads to you either leading 5-0 or being behind 0-5 at half time. Afterwards you either catch up or the opponent does and the game ends 8-7.There is zero tactics involved. Unlike in Fifa 16 all you do here is pass to Mbappe and run to score a goal. Nothing else works. Passes never work, crosses never work, only run and shoot.DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS

Publicada el 8 enero
																THIS PRODUCT IS SO BROKEN IT SHOULDN'T EVEN BE AVAILABLE FOR SALE.Seriously, the subreddit for the PC version is just 90% people asking how to get the game to actually work normally. I'm one of the "lucky" people that actually manged to get the game to load (seems about half of PC players can't even get the game to do that). I've "played" 5 hours, of which I've spent the vast majority just testing different fixes to try and get the game to play for more than 2 minutes without entering an unacceptable spiral of lags and slowdowns (all done offline, so not a connection issue).The game is genuinely broke. I haven't played a FIFA in like 15 years and never will again after this. I've requested a refund but doubt I'll get it (luckily was on Steam sale so not lost a full price game). If - through this review - my suffering leads to EA being denied even just one more sale I'll feel like I've done some good.As I said in the intro, this game is legitimately so broken it shouldn't be allowed for sale on Steam. It was only after I bought it and encountered problems that I found all the countless threads across multiple sites from people complaining about how they can't even get the game to load, and those that can can't get it to actually run properly. Even people with high end setups can't get it running properly. Interestingly, almost all of the responses on places like Reddit to "fixes" saying "Wow, thanks, this really helped!" are made by accounts with only 1 lifetime comment...It's robbery, plain and simple. They know the game doesn't work properly yet they still allow people to buy it. I've even seen comments from people saying they contacted EA directly and were told the game won't actually run on the advertised minimum specs. It's a disgrace. If you have any sense, save your money. If you read this review and then still buy the game afterwards then you deserve everything that's coming to you. Until they come out with some sort of patch this game will remain largely unplayable. Just note that there are people still having the same problems getting the game to even run in the first place as people that bought it at release, so don't hold your breath for a miracle from EA.To quote from my refund request: "I know you probably get complaints about this sort of thing all the time and just dismiss them, but I just want at least one person at your company to know that this genuinely is disgraceful. It's despicable. I despise you (the company, not the person) and hold you in nothing but sheer, utter contempt for allowing this game to be sold in this state because you don't have the balls to put your customers first and tell EA to get stuffed until they fix it. You are a joke. A miserable, sad joke of a company. It's not your fault the game is so un-optimised for PC, but absolutely is your fault for having it on your service knowing full well the state it's in. I hope you go bust some time in the near future you sack of c---s."TL;DR - Save your money. Go to the pub instead. At least you'll actually get what you ordered and it'll function as intended.UPDATE: Quell surprise, I didn't get the refund. I did however turn the FPS down to 30 on the NVIDIA control panel and that just about makes the game playable, as long as you don't have a bunch of background stuff open etc. It still glitches it from time to time, but it's a least semi-playable for those already stuck with the game.UPDATE 2: Having played a decent number of hours on the game now (game still runs poorly) I have to say it's very "meh". It's main redeeming qualities are that it's basically the only choice now for someone who wants to play a football game and that the player animations are quite cool. Sadly the player physics (collision etc) are terrible. Even highly agile players turn like buses in this game. The player switching system is laughably bad, which contributes to the terrible defending. Clearly the game was designed to favour attacking, but a very specific type of attacking as crosses are abysmal and almost never work except in cases when you could just pass the ball anyway. Corners are equally rubbish as a result. The AI is terrible. The difficulty level  jumps wildly from one step to the next and is implemented in just about the worst way you could imagine. The passing logic is appalling and the game draws on the "Psycho Mantis: I CAN READ YOUR MIND!!" school of AI attacking. They don't do anything particularly clever or new at higher difficulties, they just read your inputs and go the other way. You're left with a situation where you essentially have to wait for the AI to misplace a pass to get the ball back. Keep in mind that Pro Evolution Soccer 4 came out in 2004 and that's a better overall football game. Yes, a game that is 19 years older. That's equal parts hilarious and tragic. Even having bought it on a Steam sale it barely justifies its price. I can't imagine someone paying full price for this. You'd have to be mad.

																In short, don't buy this game.The game in general is the buggiest game I've ever played. Every single update makes the game unable to launch and you need to find a fix for it (luckily since it affects the whole player base someone always finds a fix). It seems the game itself knows it's not worth playing. This alone has convinced me to not buy any EA title in the future.I'm probably in the minority who plays player career and likes to play as the character. They added purchasable items with your wage which are all worthless and content dead on arrival. You got injured? Well, now your club has put you on the transfer list and you're unable to get off it. Every. Single. Time. The game-play is also trash (playing on ultimate difficulty with no sliders). if you don't play in defence, you will concede. The defensive AI for your team seems to not understand what marking is, which is baffling considering the opponents seem to know. Your team's defenders also do something that I don't quite understand which is play people onside all the time? no idea what that's about. Got a move to league leaders with the best defence in the league in January... we ended up conceding about 10 goals more than bottom of the table and finishing 5th. It's just predictable after a while.---Update the next day. Decided to give it one last chance and it decided to change me from CAM to GK with 40 minutes to go. Safe to say it's uninstalled and will never reinstall.---Please don't give EA or FIFA any money to pay their "devs" for this horrible game.

Publicada el 12 de octubre de 2022
																DISCLAIMER 1: I haven't owned or played a FIFA game since 1998 (PS1, Blur song :). I have no interest or intention of playing Ultimate team. I realize the game might be a hot buggy mess for many PC users- but I've had no issue, besides having to disable a controller setting in Steam and update my Nvidia drivers. DISCLAIMER 2: I'm American so I have very little exposure to the game of Futball. I might be able to name  half of the premier league teams, the powerhouse clubs of each major country, and a handful of the game's biggest stars. I'm a wannabe fan. I bought FIFA 23, despite all the terrible reviews for 3 reasons: 1). World Cup is coming up and it's mostly the only Futball I ever watch- I love the event and thought the game would give me a primer.2). I'm enjoying the hell out of the FX series, "Welcome to Wrexham." I've 100% bought in to the concept, history, and pride that comes with supporting a local club. Already started my Paul Mullin career.3). Wrexham has given me the catalyst to finally pay attention to the Premier league and I'm excited to play out some matches, learn the teams, and stream(watch) some real games Saturday/Sunday Mornings. HONEST REVIEW:Really enjoying the game- it mostly feels like the experience I remember from 20+ years ago. It's still a video game, so if you're a purist and expect a 100% translation of reality you'll probably get annoyed by the lack of anticipation and reactions of your fellow AI teammates, but that's all part of the game (why don't players follow up on my missed shots!). THE GOOD:Career mode seems very cool. Again, haven't played in EA game in a long time, so maybe this is a tiresome feature, but I find it surprisingly deep and fun to play out (in various ways),The Tutorial and Training games are excellent and I feel like I'm given the basics and the tools to hone my skills later. While the controls can be frustratingly precise it honestly feels like practice will be rewarded. The Graphics are quite good, as is the sound. The announcers will probably become tiresome, but I enjoy their banter.THE BAD:The Menus feel obtuse to me as a new player, especially as far as understanding the diverse game modes.I haven't found a (tournament) mode that incorporates international teams (like a World Cup?). Maybe that's coming- seems like an oversight. I believe I can build my own custom tournament but that's a bit cumbersome for something so iconic to the sport. I can't comment on online play or ultimate team, neither have any interest for me personally. I understand that's a huge draw for the franchise, but there's too much content for a new FIFA owner to wade through I can't see myself bothering any time soon.Origin, but whatever....So if by any chance you're a player like me, getting a little gray around the temples, with a burgeoning interesting and appreciation for the beautiful game, little to no FIFA experience, I think you'll be pleasantly surprised with this title.

																I'm giving this a thumbs-down, despite liking this game—the visuals are improved, the inclusion of women's leagues is long overdue, and I absolutely adore the soundtrack—but there are HUGE, glaring issues with this game that are frankly unacceptable in anything that isn't an early access game.First and foremost, whoever thought it would be okay to require players to enter their BIOS and mess around with settings to even get into this game needs to seek other employment. I've never seen that in any PC game. It's unacceptable and if this is a requirement in FIFA 24 (or whatever the next game gets called), count me out entirely.Next, there are lots of bugs that need serious fixing. For instance:* In manager mode, you'll frantically try and switch to the player nearest the ball while said player stands around scratching his butt and watching the ball roll past him.* Free kicks with keyboard and mouse controls are comically bad. You'll aim directly at the player you want to pass to, and the game will decide to pass to whoever it feels like. And accuracy in free kicks on goal? Fughedaboutit* Also in manager mode: if I make a team myself, I shouldn't be able to get fired from that team no matter how poorly—or in some case, how *great*—that team performs. It's my team. I made it. Make that count for something. And on this subject, if I take a team from EPL 2 all the way to the premier league, winning champion's league titles, FA cups, and more along the way, all of that hardware needs to offer extra job security and have an affect on leeway for season objectives. It's absurd this isn't a thing.* Lots of other bugs make this feel like an early access game. The key difference being that an early access game will usually listen to player feedback and fix bugs through playtesting.I recommend this game only if you're a hardcore FIFA series fan. If you're more of a casual soccer/ football fan looking for a fun game, try FIFA 22. It's still a bit buggy, but at least you aren't required to mess with BIOS settings for some reason.
