Publicada el 2 de diciembre de 2022
																FIFA 23 is just a fine game. I'm going to play it because there's no other football game alternatives. Career mode at it's roots is always good. It's a shame how dead the mode is in regards to updates every year. Ultimate Team feels fine as well, but the over saturation of content is crazy. It's so much content that it feels like you can't go a day without playing the game because if you do, you'll start to lose match after match to the new meta card.It's fine. I like FIFA 23 on every other console. The PC port is such a disgrace. First day bugs which had you crashing every time you opened packs. Patches which randomly cause FPS stutters. I'm sure they had literally no idea of their market when making this game. I know that FIFA 22 didn't lag because it wasn't running the new gen port. I know my graphics card and CPU aren't the greatest. But seriously. It's really upsetting I can't experience this game at a stable frame rate.

Publicada el 28 abril
																EA is hands down the worst gaming company on planet Earth and that's saying a lot. This game. Oh boy. From the scripted goals to the predictable pack luck, this game has it all. You could be up 5-0 until the 60th minute but the game has predetermined that your team was chosen to lose so you will concede 6 goals. You have a sliver of 1% of packing a tradable player worth more than 100K. Also, the fouls. EA have tuned the refs so much so that the fouls do not make sense. Within one game you may see a double foot brexit tackle by a cb into a st with no foul called but then you'll see a st go for a shot, have his leg hit by a defender and it'll be a foul on the st. It is incredible. By the way, if you want to keep up with these try hard 5 star skiller players with 1200 hours on the game, the only thing you can do to stop them is tackle them for red cards. One more extreme issue with the game is that the scores are moronic. I've played games where I've lost 12-0. Have you ever seen a real football game end 12-0? It's an insane feat if games end like 5-4 in real life. The announcer even says it when that score happens in fifa. "I'd have to go back in my book of records to find a game with this high of score." It happens almost every game if you haven't already been blown out by Mbappe and Jarzhino by the 30th minute.I will admit I have 400 hours on Fifa 23 purely because I've been addicted to Fifa since 2013. I don't have this amount of hours because this is an enjoyable game. I'm ecstatic that there is another viable option in football games coming this next year and I can say adios to EA permanently. Please please please do not buy this game and for the love of god do not buy fifa points.0/10 I wouldn't recommend this to my worst enemy.

																This game is quite possibly the glitchiest, buggiest, poorest excuse for an EA title I have ever played. It's quite a shame because the game itself is very fun. The new motion is incredibly realistic and the content is great. However, the cons far outweigh the pros. For me:- The game resets completely every time I open the game. I have to go back into the settings and turn off the music, change my camera, etc. EA has known of this issue for months, yet refuses to fix it. If that doesn't speak to their lack of commitment in putting out a good game, I don't know what will.- Play your own career is completely scuffed out. There isn't even an option to load a previous saved profile. You have to half-ass it and create a new profile, wait 5 minutes to get to the menu, back out, and only then will the option to load your previous career show up. It's ridiculous. Again, another easy issue they refuse to put the effort in to fix.- Countless other issues including low FPS, random crashes, etc.and I only have like 12 hours in the game... I've actually gotten more frustrated with their lack of care just by typing all this out.TL;DR - Gameplay is quite solid. Trash UI, bugs, no patches, & more make it completely not worth it.

																i want to share some tips for 60fps gameplay!this tips only for user with frame rates problem, "NVIDIA USERS ONLY"- - update your windows to the latest version, also every driver on your motherboard brand utility app to the latest. - update your GPU driver to the latest too! - go to windows settings or typing on your windows search "choose power plan", choose the high performance or ultimate performance for make sure your GPU running properly. - open your FIFA instalation folder, like steamlibrary, and then common, fifa23. right click on fifa23, then properties. on compatibility settings, make sure "disable fullscreen optimization" is on, after that on the same compatibility settings, choose "change high DPI settings". make sure "override high DPI" is on. then ok and apply. - open nvidia control panel, from windows search, or right click on the desktop. - on NVIDIA control panel, go to manage 3D settings, follow my step, just change what i said :1. open GL rendering GPU : NVIDIA bla bla bla (choose your gpu)2. power management mode : prefer max performance3. shader cache size : unlimited4. texture quality : quality5. vertical sync : use the 3D aplication settings - after that click apply. - then open "program settings" on the NVIDIA control settings, click "add" and choose fifa23. if on "add" button not showing fifa23, let find it manualy from "1. select a program to costumize :" and you'll be fine fifa23.exe - settings fifa23 on NVIDIA like before, :1. open GL rendering GPU : NVIDIA bla bla bla (choose your gpu)2. power management mode : prefer max performance3. texture filtering anisotropic : on4. texture filtering quality : high performance5. texture filtering trilinear optimization : on6. vertical sync : adaptive - then apply. - open fifa 23, go to visual settings in-game 1. dinamic resolution : off 2. vsync lock to 60 or unlimited (i prefer lock to 60fps, it's may follow your monitor refresh rate likes me 75hz) 3. quality : ultra (I suggest adjusting it to your VGA, cause i've rtx 3070) rtx 3050-4090, go for high or ultra settings. 4. resolution : 1080p,  depends on your monitor, but i sett to 1080p for stabilize the performance. 5. restart your fifa 23, then open it again. enjoy. - i hope this helps you <3

Publicada el 1 de octubre de 2022
																"This is probably the worst FIFA I have ever played and I have played every game from FIFA 10 till date. From the god awful performance to the non-responsive game mechanics, this is hands down the lowest FIFA game-play has ever felt off launch"This was my review for FIFA 23 after about 24 hours into the game. But now that I have 900+ hours on the game I feel like my review needs an update. Just as a heads up, I only play Ultimate Team. I don't play career mode and therefore my entire review is based on the FUT experience.After playing the game for so long I have genuinely noticed an improvement in the overall game-play and performance of the game. I have upgraded from a 1050Ti to a 3060 during the period of this game which definitely has improved my experience with the game. But credit where credit is due, FIFA 23 has definitely improved since my first review.There still persists some issues in game such as - 1) The general bugs and glitches that come with every FIFA instalment (nothing game-breaking in my opinion).2) Server instabilities and random disconnects (once every 100 games in my experience).But I must say, these 2 issues that I have faced have not deterred me from playing the game. I am sure that everyone who plays this game will agree the worst part of the game is the toxic opponents and the terrible display of unsportsmanlike conduct in game. From quitting at 0-0 to straight up hacks in game, it is the community that has spoilt my experience to the most extent in this game,But I can't pin that on EA. I will have to accept that it is our fault for making the game as intense and unnecessarily toxic as it has become. I experienced my first ever week long ban in this FIFA since I started playing FIFA 10. And the ban was over a message of me confronting a guy who quit at 0-0 multiple times while matching up against me. This was a new experience which has both annoyed and amused me at the same time.All in all I feel these are my positives and negatives about the game-Positives-1) FUT is as fun a game mode as every year.2) Pretty good game-play (on the more recent graphics cards)3) Amazing card designs on FUT (give those card designers a raise!)4) Continuous content that makes me want to play the game regularlyNegatives - 1) Lag spikes and random server related issues2) Toxic community Overall I would like to say that I suggest to buy this game only if you really like football and like to play FIFA with your mates from time to time. The entire concept of building teams and playing online against randoms and friends and slowly strengthening your team is always the biggest selling point for me on this game.However, if your just looking to enjoy game-play mechanics with a fun sit down session after work to play some online games without wanting to rage and possibly break controllers. I would suggest waiting for the next iteration of the game and hoping it gets better.

Publicada el 8 enero
																I've played FIFA games for a long time, the first edition I played a lot of was FIFA 2000. I don't buy every edition but every once in a while I will buy one out of reminiscence of how good these games once were, just in case they manage to produce a good one. But if I take a step back and consider the quality of the gameplay itself (not the graphics or 'realism' that has naturally improved through the years due to advancing technology) I think these games peaked quite a long time ago and have been on a long slow downwards trajectory ever since. Every year they add some new engine or other promising new levels of realism blah blah blah but the result is more often than not a bloated, glitchy mess of a game.I really wish I could enjoy this game and give it a positive review but to be honest if you're a long time FIFA player considering whether to drop £60 (lol) on this game, I'd recommend that you don't, and instead just fire up an older game to get your football fix as this just isn't it.

																UPDATE ----------- 4th October 2022-----------TLDR; Buyer beware. Save your money until EA fix their broken software!It's now 7 days since EA launched FIFA 23, and there's still no sign of them fixing the broken "EA Easy Anti-Cheat" bugs which are preventing so many PC players from even starting the game. Even worse, EA have been silent about the PC version's issues since 30th September, when they claimed to be working on a fix. This is pretty disgraceful "customer service".I tried a few other suggestions from PC players in the EA FIFA forums over the weekend, but still no joy getting this game to run. I'm giving up for now. I'll continue to wait for the publisher to issue a fix for their broken game, but if it's not here before the 14th day then I'm claiming my Steam refund.ORIGINAL REVIEW-------------------------------------------------------I spent 2 frustrating hours last night, trying in vain to get FIFA 23 running on 2 different machines.It wouldn't load on either PC, thanks to EA Anti-Cheat. It produced a different Anti-Cheat error on each machine.Tried the different suggestions on the EA forums, nothing has worked. My PC was already configured for Secure Boot as recommended (strange that no other game has ever required this). In short, EA don't have any answers right now.Meantime, Steam says I have 28 minutes play time, when I haven't even got into the main menu!VERY close to refunding right now, while I still can. I've never had this much trouble with a brand new game.

Publicada el 1 de octubre de 2022
																Edit: Been playing offline modes for one month now and i can say without a doubt that i wasted my money on this garbage game. Same issues from past FIFA still exists. Most frustating mode is player carrer mode. Your AI team mates are dumb no matter the overall rating they have. Goalkepers will try to save only if they can save a goal with their fingertips.Worst goalkeeper AI in FIFA for years. There are no fouls, penalties(again this year). If you made a striker with number 9 and let say you play for Real Madrid you will get the number 9 with 67 overall and Benzema will get next free number which is just ridicolous. I dont mind losing against an AI but going from FIFA 22 where in player carrer mode you couldnt concede a goal to FIFA 23 where every team will score on you no matter the ratings of the teams and the goals you concede are just painful to watch. Errors that your team mates are doing in defence i have never seen in real life foootball. This game doesnt deserve to be called a simulation because it just isnt. Worst thing is that there are no competitors in this genre and EA gets away with it. The best news are that EA lost licence for FIFA and that in the future we will have more football games. Maybe next year FIFA will be a truly new game not just an updated FIFA 17 7.0. EA Sports should be banned from making games after another year of the same game over and over. Basically this game is patched fifa 22 which is patched fifa 21 and so on till fifa 17 or 16. PC version is buggy as hell. Game wont save personal setting or carrer mode. Anti Cheat wont let you start a game and so on. I play on i7 10th gen with rtx 2070 and the amount of lag in cut scenes, pause menu is just disgusting. I play only offline modes because i dont ever play modes with (pay to win)microtransactions. Gameplay is dissapointing because no effort was put into it to feel like a football match. In player carrer mode your AI defenders show you just how much this game is scripted(and every other past FIFA). I played every FIFA since FIFA 98 and this FIFA is the worst dissapointment. To have same game for 6-7 years is one thing, but to have it same and  unfinished for launch is just criminal.  For 70 eur its a rip off.....

Publicada el 24 enero
																I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Publicada el 18 mayo
																As an avid football enthusiast, I recently had the unfortunate experience of attending Fifa 23, and I must say it was a truly disappointing and frustrating affair. The game failed to live up to even the most basic expectations, leaving me with a sense of dissatisfaction and regret.First and foremost, the quality of play on the field was subpar. The teams appeared disorganized, lacking coordination, and struggling to execute even the simplest of plays. The players seemed unprepared and lacked the necessary skill and finesse one would expect from a professional or even an amateur game. It was disheartening to witness countless misplaced passes, sloppy tackles, and an overall lack of cohesion among the teams.Furthermore, the game lacked any significant moments of excitement or intensity. The pace was sluggish, and there was a noticeable absence of thrilling offensive plays or impressive defensive maneuvers. The lack of creativity and strategic gameplay made for a tedious viewing experience, leaving the crowd yearning for something more engaging and captivating.Adding to the disappointment was the poor officiating. The referees seemed inconsistent in their decision-making, often missing blatant fouls or making questionable calls that left both players and spectators bewildered. This further contributed to the overall frustration and sense of injustice throughout the game.The stadium atmosphere did not fare any better. The crowd appeared disinterested, with a lack of energy and enthusiasm. The lackluster performance on the field seemed to dampen any potential excitement, resulting in a flat and uninspiring atmosphere. It felt like a missed opportunity to create a vibrant and engaging experience for fans.In conclusion, Fifa 23 was a complete letdown. From the lack of quality play, absence of thrilling moments, and poor officiating to the underwhelming atmosphere, it failed to deliver the excitement and enjoyment that fans anticipate from a football match. As a spectator, I left the game feeling deeply unsatisfied and questioning the value of my time and investment. I sincerely hope that future games in this league or competition will strive for higher standards and provide the thrilling experience that football fans deserve.
